"The spectacle thus reunites the separated, but it reunites them only in their separateness.
—G.B.
[L]anguage engenders and enshrines the appearance of manifest unification. Let us explore this assertion, for it is composed from myriad phenomena and their observation. By engendering, or the bringing about of, the appearance of manifest unification we mean to identify the systematic confluence of like linguistic objects. At varying levels of linguistic categorization, we may observe common traits of words, phrases and statements. Often, in linguistic and philosophical circles, we denote two self-evident levels at which commonality may occur by invoking the superficial grammar of language, which is described by dictionaries and the like; and on the other front, we assume that which the "language philosophers" of the early-to-mid 20th century assumed: that there exists a "logic" to language which is not apparent by its superficial schematization. By "superficial," we mean not to demean, undermine or underestimate the import and significance of any advance past or present in the philological or lexical sciences (the linguistic sciences). We mean merely to acknowledge the objective quality of languages itself; namely, that languages possess an empirical form which may be subject to the governing laws of nature and the probabilistic psychophysical relations which hold between signs and perceivers and users of those signs. In the way that one may observe the empirical properties of a caution sign, one may observe the empirical properties of the letterforms or glyphs by which the caution sign transmits its message. These concrete properties may be analyzable as such, and in the way that the contours of the sign itself may be studied, as a geometric approximation, as a object subject to the physical laws; i.e., gravity, etc. So then, with the logical form of language, we may observe laws not essentially physical, such that the laws discovered may not answer to, or be reducible to, the physical laws. To underscore the distinction, we admit the pyschophysical relation specifically identified as our acquisition of language. Language, admittedly, must be learned through experience; and under a scientific viewpoint, by the encountering of or the stimulus of graphemes and phonemes in their actualized mode of presentation (i.e., concrete sentences expressed in texts or through speeches). We assume that there are pyschophysical laws governing the acquisition of language and the effects which actualized language has on the neural structures of the brain. These laws are in category fundamentally different from the laws of reason, or the laws by which like entities are identified as such. We mean, then, to identify sentences such as The unicorn carried them beyond the horizon. Whatever a unicorn amounts to must be described by a language of some sort, and it may be said to exist in virtue of its accordance with reality or its accordance with logical properties which any thing bears. Its practitioners participate in, or even facilitate, the constant alignment of signs; with such a force, when with superficial grave empathy, such that the signified becomes obfuscated. But even more, we may say that the signified becomes obscured in its total reality. From the indetermination of the unassailable signified, the sign prevails as the dominate object of the thought. We may say, the object which must be thought. Down to the most granular, the object which must be thought must be thought in sole virtue of the possibility of its presence. So, say, the trip of an emotional rift between persons: that which is signified is the opposition between persons, but the description of such an event befuddles the observer and the player. The opposition is the object which must be thought, for its desire is to be the precipitate to its own resolve:

item.title: Language in isolation; Our Philosophers on Holiday
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We read the contemporary philosophers, those subtle charlatans unbeknown to even themselves as they wax sober on the radicalism and dogmatism of our technological age. Recorded the Greek historian Thucydides, echoing a still-truth which is today obscured by Our Philosophers rankly cool and "analytic" tone --

"ability  to understand a question from all sides meant that one was totally unfitted for action"

-- the imagination of the philosophers and discursive procedures of their trade enable them to squirm and grope through the bloodied topics as if on a battlefield of their own. The demand for clarity becomes no less different from the imperative to slay one's opponent on the peace-torn skirmish-grounds. And so what am I getting at here? Well, I aim to say something about language, as per usual. But the essential question is, as always: how is philosophy possible? How is it possible for an author to engender such a queer kind of dialogue with himself and his Self? (The Self as an impetus to enquiry and the self as that which is the coagulation of the historical entity -- a collection of events, acquisitions of knowledge, facts, dispositions, moods, persona, etc.? -- The historical self and the essential Self, that which does not "follow" from one's being-as-past, but that which is autonomous being-as-such.) Something aloof is that which guides such a misanthropic tendency to behave intellectually as one "ought." Disinterested and disenchanted truth is the aim of the philosophers, and presumably it has a structure: indeed, it is language -- or Language -- who bears the tainted marked, the markings as structure, as structured, as the structure, on which thought is manifest. Stability in the world of Senses, Propositions, Concepts, transfer into the world of Language, our World. What might I mean by "stability"? The God of Isaac and Job and Moses and of itself is such a being-quaint-being, familiar and stable in culture, through or by virtue of the trails and trajectories of history, empires have carried it into our everyday, and perhaps into the every-other-day of our children. Nevertheless, it persists: it is a persistent concept, insistent even, demanding, commanding, reputable-without-why. Acknowledging these facts, Our Philosophers touch on the topic as if the persistence of the concept in our culture's mind, as it were, similarly holds in our language. So They find Statements and Sentences representative -- candidates -- of the Party -- how pitiable is it, that! the representative-democritique. Whatever that means. Find that which has been asserted, and writhe, wail and wax woefully in that sober and sobering analysis -- but let us entertain ourselves with what is assertable! We may describe even the fauna as having made this or that assertion, with our jolly and loopy mess of analogical hubris; even World equal, and thus even World bears an agent of some form or other. But what does it mean to be assertable! Similarly any argument may look justified if we switch and sham the context under which adequate justification is possible; and it is no difficult matter to imagine the justified here for them or there for us. But justifiability is a more intangible tramp, in which the discernment of context itself becomes the question. For the Nazi's, of course, that would count as an adequate justification (under the premises or foundation of their system); but let us address the question: Why do we find it insincere to describe theirs as a system at all? Assertability carries the same conceptual mark; let us not entertainment dryly what is similar between human behavior and animal behavior on the grounds of what we have done, insofar as language careens into the picture, but insofar as what is warranted, justifiable, possible, allowable -- let us address the conditions for assertions, and let us expose the fact that reasons factor into those conditions, not mere causal-law childplay and collision of inert materials. The causal conditions are not the only conditions at play when we speak of what is assertable. Moreover, let us investigate the role our assertions play in our lives, for such a concept -- the role -- partly constitutes the meaning of what we say; thus, to reiterate: to not attack the proposition, or its expression in language, as if it could be isolated.

item.title: Kripke’s puzzle
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Definitions

Millianism (M)

The meaning of a name is exhaustively accounted for by its referent; additional semantic features which we commonly attach to the name are not constitutive of its meaning.

Principle of Translation (PT)

If a proposition, p, expresses a truth in language, L, then p similarly expresses a truth in any language into which it is translated.

Disquotational Principle (DP)

If a speaker, S, of language, L, utters or expresses proposition, p (of L), then S believes p, ceteris paribus.

Hermeneutic Principle (HP)

If a name has a single referent, then it may be correctly represented in logic by a single constant.

Against Millianism Kripke, per the paper in question, wants us to believe that Millianism is safe in light of the following argument (B1-B3):

A1. B is/has X;

A2. B and C are the same thing;

A3. Therefore, C is/has X. (Valid)

Well, in that case,

B1. S believes B is/has X;

B2. [And since] B and C are the same thing;

B3. Therefore, S believes C is/has X. (Invalid)

A1-A3 is presented here to underscore a valid argument form, and, moreover, to expose the work DP plays. Generally, the point is that belief contexts make the inferences like above invalid.

Speaking to the practical relevance of this entire discussion, in any case where we are in a situation like the one in which we know propositions like B1 and B2, we are blocked from making the inference, B3, or any similar inference.

The point behind indenting the above statement is to highlight my attempt to break a kind of fourth wall which exists between author, myself, and reader, you. Kripke's "puzzle" isn't about you in any personal way; it is about the inferences human beings make implicitly, in virtue of basic assumptions about language and belief. [Edit] Kripke's puzzle, in a way, can be viewed in light of Humean skepticism. Of course, S has some belief or other about B/C, and we should be able to come down to an answer as to whether S believes that B/C has or does not have, is or is not, X. A belief on the matter is there; we are not flirting with grotesque nihilisms or arch-skepticisms; partly, the central problem here is how one might explain rational behavior in light of such a logically invalid inference. Moreover, it is presumed by the author, that such an inference is one everyone systematically makes daily; or let's just say exceptionally frequently. And of course, no one is going to doubt that the average Joe on the street may be tragically misinformed on the finer points of atonality in music theory or the most recent astronomical discoveries dripping from the pages of the most recent publication of Time; no one will doubt that the Everyperson is, on most conversational exchanges, effectively, and for universal lack of a better word, a dolt, or to say the least, isn't a PhD candidate. Such statements as "Pierre believes London is pretty" and "Joe is my gardener" are logically similar, so representation of such statements is philosophically admissible. We hazard no remiss in replacing "Joe" with J and "Pierre" with P. That said, once we get to the logical nuts and bolts, my point comes more clearly: symbolize the statements (P believes Lp, etc) and imagine or recall an event in your life where B1-B3 holds. The point here is not to ask your whether you know, in a personal and intimate way, Pierre or P or S, but to take what you do know -- propositionally, perhaps -- and expose a similarity with B1-B3 in virtue of form. From where I see things, a radical skepticism should be engendered:

How many beliefs do we attribute to others, where our chain of reasoning is similar to B1-B3; that is, on the basis of invalid reasoning? (That is, where we say, knowingly or unknowingly, that so-and-so believes such-and-such.)

Again, my thinking may be a bit murky here, but let me put it this way: Is there any substantial difference between "Pierre believes London is ugly" and the following list of statements:

Pierre believes Karl is outside;

Pierre believes Mr. Pickwick is in the elevator;

Pierre believes Leela is on the soccer team;

Pierre believes that Sam knows how to operate a forklift

On the last one, then:

C1. Pierre believes that Sam knows how to operate a forklift;

C2. Sam and Steve are the same person;

C3. Therefore, Pierre believes that Steve knows how to operate a forklift. (Invalid)

So, one might argue: Pierre doesn't have to believe anything about anything, let alone about Steve. And this brings us to our central issue: Kripke wants us to believe that this form of invalid reasoning does not present a problem for Millianism alone. Presumably, after touching Kripke's paper and assuming some philosophical training, one may look at the above argument form with the opinion that such a form exposes a serious flaw in the definition Millianism puts on proper names. Of course, says the Everyperson, Pierre doesn't have to believe any one way or another about Steve! He doesn't know anyone named Steve! Our response, then, is so much for Millianism. Names do not mean anything above and beyond their referents. But again, Kripke asks us to imagine the same argument form where Millianism is not put forth for discussion: generate the argument form from TP and DP. Now try developing it from DP alone. Try developing it without M, TP or DP. On this latter attempt, one might look to HP for guidance. But let us expose the problem in a different way.

D1. John believes that Susan is a stripper.

D2. John believes that Caroline is not a stripper.

D3. Susan and Caroline are the same person.

D4. John believes D1 and D2, where S = C.

Whereas in the previous Sam/Steve-example, we can provide a simple reply: Pierre doesn't know Steve. But in this example, substitution salva veritate gets us into trouble. Granted, in the previous example something is still amiss: Given M and P-Logic, Pierre should believe that Steve knows how to drive a forklift. Saying, "Well, he just doesn't know Steve" is a kind of hand-waving which might irritate even Moore, I think, for such a response simply fails to consider basic concepts of validity, definition, etc. Such a response is just too simple-minded, for it furthermore fails to address the issue: Why does rationality (P-Logic, etc) get us into this predicament? And if this is what rationality gets us, how do we ever get through the day-to-day? I see a strong practical dilemma here; namely, how do we even begin to talk about engaging the world, through (language and) reasoning, in a practical way. We certainly do get through the day-to-day, but it seems that we cannot have any rational basis for defending why we do. This is an echo from Hume and skeptics of that ilk. If we do progress daily in a rational way, then, we might demand that to say that we do, we must explain why we do, lest accept that "rationality" means, strictly speaking, nothing at all. (So much for Christians and Republicans being "psychopaths," etc. -- so much for the cool, apathetic criticism of postmodernites who can "pardon" stupidities of Biblethumpers and Loveless Scientists, for "pardoning" in this way is justifiable only in terms of an established "baseline rationality," one for which we are at a loss, given a little legwork from the fundamental conceptual machinery previously provided from the argument form.) Assuming Kripke is correct on the matter, on generating the paradox without M and with DP and PT,  in order to save us from invalid inference, we must drop either DP or PT. That is, to prevent the argument from even getting off the ground, we would have to drop garden variety assumptions we intuitively make daily. So, if one drops PT, one would be committed to the line of thought, possibly, that (1) different languages have different truths, (2) propositions are not expressed by statements, etc, etc. Quite clearly (1) is an unacceptable principle to be committed to, especially if one considers the milktoast variety of statements to which we are focused. (2) may lead one to arguably acceptable position that propositions to do not exist, or that they do exist but that statements are not the right kinds of things which pick them out. Moreover, the entire commitment puts one in a place of having to account for a possible self-counterintuitive notion of truth, what can be its bearers (what can be true or false), etc. But, as mentioned earlier, the argument form can be generated without PT; but the question then remains whether there exists a class of problems from which PT is necessary for that class's construction. Kripke suggests, if I recall correctly, that the argument form may be generated by DP alone, bearing in mind the feature of homophony in language. In his Paderewski-experiment, E1. S believes that Paderewski is X. E2. S does not believe that Paderewski is X. E3. E1 & E2 In this case, the name "Paderewski" was picked up by S in two different contexts, but each name picks out the same individual, where S is unaware. Say that, for E1, S overheard that "Paderewski is X" on the radio, and for E2, S's sister informs her that Paderewski is not X. Being credulous so far as radio and her sister goes, she absorbs and forms mutually excluding beliefs about "Paderewski." They're both, the radio and her sister, talking about the same person, but for whatever reason S hasn't made the connection. Perhaps S forms the belief found in E2 through her own introspection while driving home, given the talk with her sister, but fails to modify the belief in E1 because she, S, cannot believe that her sister would know anyone actively working in radio or associated with radio, let alone Paderewski. But this is going to far: Why should S believe that the same person is being referred to in virtue of having the same name? Generalizing and factoring such an assumption into the definition of names, or proper names, first goes against intuition and habit: do we systematically, or merely frequently, take in names and check whether they refer to the same individuals, places, things, etc? Second, the affirmative to such a question would commit one to the queer metaphysical notion that names contain those entities picked out. The difference is that the former point requires a peculiar assumption about human habit, and the latter requires outright nonsense: in what sense do names contain the entities themselves for us to judge new name bearers? The name itself doesn't tell who its bearer is; its meaning is its referent; its meaning (referent) isn't told to you by its syntax. But this is all assuming a veracity given to Millianism.

item.title: More on naming
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
A feature of a name: such that the thing to which it is a potential name can have meaning. A name tracks, or springs into existence (semantic baptism). But we might use the thing in various social practices despite its lack of a name. A theory, a tool, a digital device, etc. One might refer, successfully, to the object or thing, communicating an intention, etc. Must we possess a language(0) in order to understand the semantic significance of any mundane object, or thing, which rests beneath, or perhaps founds, our natural language, language(1)? In language(1), the potential name is actualized: "hammer". But if this term does not exist in language(0) for speaker, S, then we have a question as to the relationship between language(0, S, t) and language(1, S, t).
We may call language(0, S, t) the pre-linguistic. Rational human behavior persists under this frame; certain names for objects, at various points of manifest rational activity, do not exist. Given this, the object/term relation does not exist for any given speaker. One question is what rationality amounts to if an assumption is made such that only object/term relations can count as evidence toward a determination of an event within the cognitive system of any given speaker. (Vague; edit.) Moreover, (assuming) a name is never given through ostensive definition, how can we reliably track the rates at which names are introduced to human agents? Whether the rates are astronomical in acquisition is irrelevant: we are concerned with the tracking of principles of naming. We aim to understand the rates of introduced principles which may be spread across years and a multitude of experience. These would be tractable.

item.title: A cursory comment on HTML5 today
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: http://www.w3.org/News/2011#entry-9105 HTML5 has two names. One for what it's doing in relation to the open source movement, and the other for its specification. The spec is just a bunch of semantics. The former is about the shit that is mistaken for being part of the spec. (http://blog.codinginparadise.org/2010/06/html5-defined-its-not-just-marketing.html) HTML5 has kicked Flash out of the mobile market. Some think that's only the first consequence of Apple's push against Flash, on the one hand, and the shit storm that is the non-iPhone mobile device market. Apple's operating revenue is nearly equal to the top four mobile device providers. When they say "change the channel" people listen. It's not really HTML5 that's going to "wow" people. Or rather, if it is, it'll be acknowledged analogously to how most people today acknowledge apache. HTML5 itself doesn't mean much to most people. It's all the fancy gaming stuff that will get dropped on top of that platform of semantics. And all that is JavaScript and CSS. These two have their own set of specs and APIs to hash out. Web Workers, WebStorage and WebSockets are all coming all nicely. When those hit Recommendation Status, that is when you'll see the Internet taken over by the Web.

item.title: Last words on #sopa
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I'm sure many of you developers feel overwhelmed. By other, more esteemed developers, you're being told to get back to work. In the django forums, for the language's development, the core developers are kicking #sopa noise out. I just started learning assembly, and I don't have time for this shit. But now, as I browse sites like kippt or what have you, I'm encountering "stop censorship" JavaScript overlays. Sudden protests. Hell, my personal site has one up. Imagine if protestors were to march through your shoppes? Through your playgrounds. Through your streets? They're doing this on the Web and by #occupy. Shats like this bloke are trying to device conceptual structures to enable the respective offended industries. While developers are demanding that Google or somebody with some steam take a stand. More blight on the Web. I don't want relics and snapshots of this war-state littered in my fucking inbox, in my browser. I don't want to install Tor. I don't want to take the effort to browse securely. I don't want to type my password in more quickly because you're standing over my shoulder. I want no passwords, no certificates. "Go the fuck away with the fear-mongering" I want to say. And everyone thinks -- I use this term loosely -- it's all unrelated. #occupy is protesting in the street. They're sacrificing themselves through show of bravado to gain media and tactical advantage. #anonymous has published video propaganda. And some hackers have publicly discussed targeting Senators, efforts to destroy their careers. The issue is not that the legislation will pass. (Fuck predictions.) The issue is that the context in which the legislation will be discussed and voted on. The context is Marshall Law (NDAA). Do you understand how spiritually troubling this is? To know that your country declared Marshall Law AFTER the vote on #sopa and #pipa were PUSHED BACK? I give. I firmly believe in a couple of months, this country will exist as a Stalinist state. And I'm not going to do anything about it. I need to get back to work.

item.title: Happiness
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Now that I think about it, Google is the reason I've found happiness. Well, not the Happiness you're thinking of. I usually try to avoid big concepts. I ask the wrong questions because I assume nothing is too big to fall. I s'pose I have trained my mind to enjoy what is common and what can be exposed easily. This, indeed, makes search easier. I enjoy it here, deep within the Shallows. The mind may find many things unto eternity if one keeps pace resilient and syntax familiar.

item.title: They tell me to get a gun
item.dc:creator: admin
admin
item.content:encoded: Because, well, maybe nobody ever put it this way. In language, we are trapped to refer. Much like anything else, we defer quite contently each aspect.

item.title: To piece it all together (and read it like you mean it)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
My plan was to be the fastest. Before high school, my plan was to be the fastest person on this earth. I wanted to break a world record. I wanted to do this because I thought I had HIV/AIDS. Even today, the GOP wages a war on women, half shrouded by fantastical lies and essential hatred, misogyny. I agree with Gil Scott Heron, the revolution will not be televised. The media: FOX, CNN, MSNBC, etc., function based on how well they can filter lies, but not only this: filter lies along a narrative, a story, this political economy consumes daily, habitually. I count the sirens along the streets. And I wonder if cops howling behind me would simply put on their signals and get over. I cannot tell whose chasing who, or if it's all a ruse to establish a baseline anxiety about my country. McCain would have this. Fear is essential to belief; one cannot have belief without fear, as it were. But: "Simplicity is essential to brilliance". The man, Mr. Bruce Lee, isn't even from this nation-state. He too was alienated from the start: the idea that the Home structures at all. I was born in a ghetto. I lived at Gun's Point for a spell. This was supposed to have been my Home. And that it structures me completely. Of course, I don't buy it. I am what I am. It is an interesting thought that I have come to, a transcendence, if you will.
Where I am, there you will find Africa.
My story will be told. It will last. And I will burn this country to the ground, federal building by federal building if I have to. I will blow up your house. I have seen my people culturally raped by this country. I have been convinced not to see them. And even now I today carry a mark of the Black Sheep. (If you're wondering, Black Sheep are the Black Americans in my sci-fi novel; they are a race different from the Earthshakers, who are the Indo-Europeans. And I am a clever virus.) The television gave me the power not to see my people, and I have seen nothing but thuggery, gangsterism, self-violence, other-violence, racial hate crime perpetrated against the same race, sexual experimentation with our race, and essential hatred. Even today homeless men pick fights with me in the street, instead of bowing out painfully as they usually do; and yet I can cast spells with the computer system. For all intents and purposes I am a sorcerer, a master of information, a master of the machine. And yet I live in a society that marks me. For my hair preference. In a society where anyone wears and looks like whatever he or she wishes, I am marked. What guidance does "cut your hair bring" other than that one should obey. Again:
Where I am, there you will find Africa.
Had you once thought that I might be the coming of the end? Try me. Try me.  I will not allow the television that it should make corruption out of me. I am a virus. I am the virus. Once I realized the television spoke lies, being the feebly intellect I was at 13 or so, I woke up, as tritely as it can be put. The cost was that I had developed a means to establish my name, a name as the Author of Pentateuch lists. As Marcus Aurelius lists. My goal was to set a world record, as the fastest, and have my story be told. And bow out painfully, as the immune system weakens. I was 9, or 10, with little guidance, except for some brutally antagonistic boyfriend or two. Even today I have to make up the story of why I have a gash demonstrated across my left hand. First world problems, indeed; not quick enough to swallow the salt of life, not able to consume the rugged individuality ethos-schmethos. Indeed, I will blow up your house. And so I played. I lived a life of death. A life of a kind of death row. Call me melodramatic -- and I will beat the living shit out of your ass (I learned how to say that from an electro-punk band). -- I am Africa. Need it be said again? Doubtless, to be sure. And so I lived with the realization that I should live. That I will live, but with years of grief. A childhood of carelessness suddenly lost, as yet its memories linger. I found happiness in never touching, never loving, never sharing, never sipping after another, staring for too long, making eye contact, lying, self-reflection, reflection on G-d, warming self mental stimulation. For years I cultivated the most vile talent: the potential to think. My body has the behaviors of a thinker, and standardized tests in this country have for years systematically disenfranchised and plundered enumerable African-descent peoples. And now I am here, seeing this. Reading this. Understanding this. I see your Civil Rights, and now I still see nothing. Except myself. Doubly I have lived in a country that seeks to erase my history, and I have lived with a folly of mind that enables me to see the erase of my own. I might one day pick memories at will and modify them, reduce them, resize them, extend or share them in ways never thought before. I had to give up my goal of the fastest. I now aspire to be the blackest. As a virus, I aspire to end all things, your music, your rock and roll, your rap, your television, your car, paper, pens, checkbooks, convenience stores, weaponry, standing forces, railways, office buildings, your bank, your government, demagoguery, lying lobbyists who lie, scandal, bigotry, religion, hatred and lies. And even more. Everyone realizes their own limits, given this or that. I realized that I had no natural talent for great speed using my legs. No metaphysical surprise, quite. But left with little option, what was I to do with college? Religion? Politics? Business? With studies? With books? I wanted to be the fastest. -- Boring. And then I'm told my heart just won't take the run. What to you want from me? What seriously the fuck more do you want from me? I lived no real childhood. And then even the run is fucking taken from me? What the fuck do you want from me?  Coach Z plucked me from the baseball team because of my stride alone. And then I'm to find out that cardiac arrest should be my concern on top of winning a race? What the fuck do you want from me? I spent years wondering, quite truly, why the fuck I was reading whatever I was reading, and not running, the run.  Twice. Was I fooled by something some legitimate source told me. People from your world, of politics, and lies, and stupidity, and failure, and material things. First by the television, and then by a peanut gallery of doctors and cardiologists. Advisable that I not run. Who am I to debate adoctor's test? What does it even mean? How do I integrate such a prognosis into my life? And what the fuck else could Coach Z do except kick me off the team? Twice, I say -- Just run. Just try it. Is this sound advice? Does a teenager adopt it? Alone, in a closest? Can you tell? Running, wanting to be the fastest, putting my name to the idea, for a time as my only reason for existence... Running was what brought me joy. Had you ever considered it? -- For years, I was robbed of the only thing that could give me joy. Twice, I say -- Just run. Doesn't hurt to ask (try). This was Hawkman's advice, on just about everything. I reasoned that surely be might say the same about this matter. Yeah, why not? Run. I recall his machoism and anecdotes of reckless antics, I recall him severing a finger while managing some other feat. Surely, just run. Months back I ran 4-5 miles, with some acquaintances. I took a heavy drag of my cigarette and stretched in Spider's fashion before we took off. I kept pace. My heart felt as if it were going to explode. Even today I feel the horrifying heartpangs at random intervals. But I ran more. I made it regular. And this Brittany was bestially murdered. What more do you want from me? What the fuck else do you want from me? Am I existentially whining? Yes. Just whining? Yes. Will I blow up your house if you stand aback?
This is where I am. And where I am, you will find Africa.
Of a world where nothing good may persist, I must destroy it or leave it. I am set to take a train to San Francisco on the 30th of this month. From there, I will begin to develop an insurrection. Of this economy, of the edifice that is these peoples' engineered beliefs.

item.title: Notes: Every Event is Copyrightable
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Perchance it simply need be said. One might think it more inflammatory to assert, "Every Thing is Copyrightable!" But given to the brand of philosophy in which I have received training, perchance it must be restated. Or rather, I am in search of the mood in which one must be in order to perceive its truth. One characteristic maneuvre of Descriptivists is such that, X becomes non-X That is to say, a phenomenon of one sort is actually not of the sort that it is perceived. Language may mislead, and so one's perception must obey the stricture needed for language. We think into language, not in language. The positivists of the 20th century have secured this position in their logical grammars: this becomes something else. Not a proposition, but this. For the proposition is what is asserted, which can be true or false. But this becomes something else. One claim from all of this might be: What forms of cognition follow from anything that does not map to the grammar of a proposition? If someone fails to have your accent, that person must be different.  We have gone so far as to logically demonstrate this ethical principle: trust not your perceptions. Russellians et al. engage in this practice wilfully while abstaining from credence to Descartes. All to his import is nothing more than the reject of beliefs as a source of knowledge, and to this day, such a tradition persists. We fear that the phrase The president of the United States may be misleading, and we suggest this with stigma of paradox or sophistry. As more, a Tweet may be misleading. Every form of communication must be wholly constituted and situated through the means of a logical empire that set out to avoid misleading expressions. Today, all expression may be broken down into bits, emerging from the maturation of the logical empire. Indeed, every expression is a sequence of events: servers, routers, people, etc. We call this, a "world." Today, one noteworthy point that motivates governments is: The evolutionary cost of supervention. Naturally, we might look at the concepts of pluralism or even monism. What explains the Internet's supervenience on our world?  The rules for survival are different if the grouping of events need not involve matter. "Grouping of events" involves a very different kind of reference when we talk of activity within the domain of the Internet. Every event is a specification for its own continuation. In order to argue that this post is my own, I must copyright it. This post does not mean X in a legal system.

item.title: Why I Consider Psychology Bankrupt
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Many a time have I been told to "see a shrink" or "take a pill." One of my friends, after having treatment with "pills" now enjoys his sweetly-oriented bachelorhood while abstaining from talk of philosophy with women. He now often qualifies his statements to me with "it's not too technical -- so you should look into it." (He and I took mathematical logic (Logic III) together. However, early in our "friendship" he would assume that because I disagreed with him that I didn't understand some point he attempted to establish. He never thought that his thought experiment was simply poorly constructed or poorly expressed, or simply incoherent in itself.) He thinks talking philosophy "scares women off." He's an analytic philosopher. I for one am fucking bored with Americans. And Americans are are caught up in the Sex-Class Boat (a play on Sex-Criminal-Boat). I am going to fucking slap someone. I did not devote myself to my mental career, my career as a thinker, only to find myself with a fucking bullet in my head because of pissant wank American bullshit like this. Fuck you, and fuck  your fucking pills. Talk to your friends. Listen to them. Understand. I was put in jail. I was put in jail. Am I "crazy" or do I "need pills" because I am upset by such an event in my life? This "friend" was aware of this event in my life. And the murder of my ex-girlfriend. This things upset me deeply. His response? "Take pills." Why? "When I was in a bad spot, they helped me out." 1. You don't know what you are talking about. 2. You are not learned on the subject of psychology. 3. YOU. Whoever you are, PHD or not, shut the fuck up. (Stop talking Freud. Stop talking Jung. Stop making up fashionable jargon. Shut the fuck up.) Another person tells me to "take a pill," I will fucking kick them in the fucking throat. I am not fucking with you. This is beyond upsetting. (Fine, anecdotal evidence of this sort shouldn't be a point of departure for generalization.)

Fine

Anti-authoritarians question whether an authority is a legitimate one before taking that authority seriously. Evaluating the legitimacy of authorities includes assessing whether or not authorities actually know what they are talking about, are honest, and care about those people who are respecting their authority. And when anti-authoritarians assess an authority to be illegitimate, they challenge and resist that authority—sometimes aggressively and sometimes passive-aggressively, sometimes wisely and sometimes not. --  Why Anti-Authoritarians are Diagnosed as Mentally Ill
My point is this: Americans are fucking lazy.

item.title: Bablio
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
0. Opening

I am Repeatable. But first let me explain myself. Sarah asked the other day, "So why won't my boyfriend talk with me about dildos?"; or another friend lamented to me, "I don't want to just bike to point B, I want to bike to point X." And in case you're wondering, everybody realizes they need junk control. The obvious point from all of this is that political theatre is a repeatable function of social systems. The fact that Schwarzenegger picked up the heavy thing, and was a governor because of it. Barack Obama is the first black President of the United States. Rick Perry; Newt Gingrich; Alain Badiou; Tina Fey; Bob Dylan; Tupac; Richard Dawkins; Richard Feynman; Iris Murdoch; Sarah Palin; Saul Kripke; Alvin Plantinga; Quentin Smith. For decades now we have dealt thought experiments involving hot pokers which produce unexpected reports on sensation, experience machines, Turing Tests et al., artificial sweeteners, the entire facade of the Western Diet over morality, etc. Yet I s'pose you're wondering: Has he done it before? A child exits his front door, each day, to find only empty parking lots with drafted mirages delimiting every pathway. It is an Earth unpeopled, cities of silence, which lay before him, lacking any temerity save for the rustling of leaves. What here is repeatable? Is Raphael repeatable? A graph might suggest. Or perhaps the license plate game does tell. What occurs when the obscure discover their own repetition? Camus, I believe, dealt us a similar obstacle: suicide is the only interesting philosophical problem. Who might perceive the absurd that is repeatable? What might the shape of her justification be? Moreover, why any street corner? Why must any where factor in? What consideration of the causal machinery at play truly shapes the mode of justification of suicide? We might suggest that the full decontextualization of Camus' "absurd man" is our culprit: that is, it is not absurd human, but rather the absurdity of humanity; like the stove of the kettle. Justification takes the shape of context, but Camus exposes for us the shape of justification of another form: we are led to see "man" remove himself from context as though causally free. What is repeatable is one, the person, but what is not is the action: the action is free, thus unrepeatable. One is free to follow the absurd regardless of one's context. Perhaps we should say: obey the demands of the absurd. -- I, however, am Repeatable. Perhaps this, then, is our paradox.

1. "I Am An Unrelated Atom" (I prefer to do things with others rather than on my own.)

Jake is an avid chess player, perhaps even a hustler. His turf covers from about here to there, but he's wary of open files anyway. He's fairly aggressive about his knights, one might say. -- Here one might be reminded of paradoxical linguistic traps; e.g., this sentence is unprovable but true; the books of the Bishop (Peter Abelard) What makes a human being social? Is it the vagueness of one's own limits? Should language be imprecise, then how ever might one come to delineate what-is-mine from all the rest?

2. "We Have the Tools to Stop This Machine" (I prefer to do things the same way over and over again.)

In the face of automation, why should anyone wish to become a programmer? If the computer can do it, why would I ever wish to? To this we might suggest the inherent creativity of programming: the choice of repetition.

3. "Russellian Teapots" (If I try to imagine something, I find it very easy to create a picture in my mind.)

Obviously any celestial teapot is mind-independent. Regardez le mot, repetez-vous! 

4. "Paul Jennings, We Have a Problem" (I frequently get so strongly absorbed in one thing that I lose sight of other things.)

Objects, too, are repeatable. Paul Jennings realizes this: objects, things, too obey the laws of evolution. Why should this be so? Does it even make sense? What does it mean to su --- Prediction of Voice -- Not a 21st cen phil --- The emergence of Provenance (A Speaker of Tongues as Language); Empathy demands knowledge from the eyes of the Amoralist; the grace of sound in animals as one's body radiates music On Kripke book: 0, 1, ?; past, present, future; the necessity of logical structure; from present we cannot perceive the past; but not vice versa as for the future in statements Godel's Incompleteness as a predictor for suicide ethics; a discursive protoethics as a arithmetization of meta-ethical statements ("I am  not "livable" in this system" -- Fugues of Living Organic; a diet of deities' stories) Provenance rules out death; in principle 27. What if one groundhog hears something? In some previous story, we partook of the narrative. A narrative wherein one gains a hypersensitivity to objects. Indeed. There we have the form of a species. Some cannot hide their social defects, while others hide them perfectly. Our previous idea might be suggested thus: a Social Template Model exists at each planet. Sociality itself might be a factor of survivability, and if the context should be removed or nullified from the event of social interaction, a member of a species might record or become a measure for the point of departure. Hazarding an analogy, a dog's placement within a group might be triangulated by social types of a higher or lower order species. My speculation is that dogs maintain a kind of grace which records a form of harmony between species; perchance their hypersensitivity to certain sounds enables a kind of trait which might endure throughout the decay or demise of civilizations. We might not consider this a miracle, but a maximal set of conditions necessary and sufficient for survival across something greater than generations, often recorded in terms of geological timescale. Another consideration might be the scientific character of history itself, as history itself becomes a content applied to which a scientific character of history maintains a dominant role in the scientific character of history, most obviously, itself. The apologies for a digression is an indicator, surely. Aoson: A groundhog has been the butt of a number of grand joke. Bason:  Says the nihilist! How could you interrupt the rote? Aoson: Might I intercept the rhythm of a set? Bason: However your debt, there's never a bet! Aoson: _______________________________________

item.title: Shroom Union (Draft: 3 of 3)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Object Economics (The Politics of Immanent Objects)

Nothing-to-Hide Arguments and Plato's Ring of Gyges are structurally similar. Notice that Gyges had everything to hide, being the King's confidant, even to his Queen, yet the Ring represents a pure multiplicity of different situations wherein all is exposed through the power of the Ring itself, such that if these things were hidden, the user of the Ring might become powerless. The Ring ruptures the situation by its sole indifference to it, it may remain chosen or not, yet its presence enables indeterminate presentation. What might proffer the power of the Ring? -- We commonly consider who might proffer the power of the Ring. Let us consider the historicity, the ontic history, of objects, such that any object might compel us.

The Phenomenology of Things (An Anticipation of Provenance): Agent, Object, Process

By consequence, nothing normative can be drawn from the simple realist examination of the becoming of things. In particular, the victory of the market economy over planned economies, and the progression of parliamentarism (which in fact is quite minor and often is achieved by violent and artificial means) do not constitute arguments in favor of one or the other. It is the converse situation: to have everything to hide is to equate objects with power, and to lack all governance over these objects is to make the Ring pointless, uncompelling (and thus Socrate's polity vacuous). To have nothing to hide is to do the converse: that one's objects are one's power, and that to hide them is to conceal that power. Who would take the Ring of Gyges? -- Everyone, strictly speaking, who must possess a thing. I suggest that the Ring represents a basis of freedom in choosing that which should be hidden and that which should not.

The Shroomunion

Yeah, it's a band. And so is Bardo Pond. And the Spastic Mountain Choir. Perhaps I'm making this shit up, but these shrooms look like penises -- and I'm just fucking tripping out. All my limbs wobble and throbble and throttle! Every band sounds the worst, every ringing compounds, and hopelessly my ears tremble for more. I've felt the recurring echos of reverberations from years before, ghostly happenings in the most cadenced lots or garages painfully painted and sweatfully compounds, and hopelessly still. DMT rings and passing nectar dripping chipped pipes catalystically flippant and inspiring, we rolled over or I doled into another pauper bard bending his fingers against the wall of birds, and the domes of trees. I hate music, for this reason. -- I picture, or it shews me, a world where every third male co-habitates with a farm, or rather a Planned Ecosystem. Our present marriage laws must needs allow for the federal cost of what might be called technohusbandry, or, to those politically-inclined ecohusbandry. Many analogies to planning for a child and its descriptive model are transferrable to the narrative of botanical husbandry, or, more suitably rendered, farming. Our most immediate political disnarrative involves the conceptualization of the plant insofar as that field has been guided, by political interest, to obscure technology and technology it. Notice that most metaphor which we use to describe the conceptual relations of machines involves the presentation of automotive and industrial machines. Perhaps historically such a phenomenon is intuitively grasped, but as yet, the emergence of "web" (fauna, spiders) and "synapses" (flora, fungi) or "networks" comfortably adorns our scientific literature. Naturally, neuroscientific literature is similarly fashioned with a richness quotient for the plausibility of its claims -- not only must we describe the world, but it must be described beautifully. So it must be convincing. A man printed a burrito the other day, and what that does mean. "And what that does mean." One person might be capable of organizing an entire mercantile context, rather than a chain or corporation. The brand of the individual is the basis for our comfortability quotient with a corporation, the emotive impetus to make purchase from within and from the outside of its immanent force through which its market economy is installed.

item.title: A la Spinoza (Question 48)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I understand. Well, the repeatability thing for sure, but chiefly that the connexion of memories is exactly identical to the connexion of agents, processes, and events. However, memories may be implemented over digital or analogue systems. Within the set of descriptions which may imply the existence of mammals, like us, whose linguistic superpartners follow, memories properly encoded produce propositions that contradict. "Linguistic superpartners do not exist", etc. (Or something like that)^2 The idea here is the actual presentation of technology used as if organic phenotype. Certainly the actual fact must manifest itself so. However, the basic fear of technology is inconnexion with the form of its presentation through external modes. This is a difference through which a truth unfolds. Should truths exist, they would be indifferent to differences. This outlines a set of sentences non-pertinent to their survival. Do you see, it may be described as the flexability of language, and its expression through the reflexive human form, as the mode of its attribute involves a relation within the whole of Substance whose nature it is to exist by P7,  we must consider -- honestly? The nature of matter. I mean, even Spinoza was remarkably cavalier. And I, again, am a virus.

Agent, Process, Object

Imagine a material description of every agent, process, and object. This includes dinosaurs, sauropods, mammals, meteors, the roads in Kansas, the laws of gravity, your grandmother, my grandmother, every tweet made 37 hours ago, carbomb specs drafted in 1985, every war. These descriptions follow from structural similarity between these ontic categories. Memories are the connexion of relations which immanate from these descriptions, whose statements are expressed as superpartners. An agent may analyze an object. Yet agents are involved in the instantiation of a world, to which hey are objects. History, thus, becomes a science, and at once not. As such, it is the prediction of linguistic forms, such that later auhors might authorize identical dates over a period or event. But as yet, historians are technologically limited within ecological environments. Here we see that agents both structure and destructure the world. Spinoza is right, in that excellence is rare. How might the historian record adjacent cultures? The history of language begins with agent, object, and process.

Content of Empty Categories

What is the material content of agent, process, or object?

item.title: Social Templates: (Software in Space) (Question 14)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Homeostatic Stratoconomies Ready for Spacetime Primetime, Bukowskian Women on Mars, 2023

Shockrates! So you know those times when girls have to get up at the same time? Do you really notice them? It reminds me of a sitcomical situation where some boy is hung up on girls. Most people get hung up on anything. And then something happens, it happens coincidentally, sometimes not. And sometimes someone notices. Until the thought on the matter becomes empty, limited, twisted by the length of time it takes to consider the thought. It's before, now, left of something in some hemisphere, of neuronic activity and the blasphemous synapsis. It's a warzone of warzones all reducible to a set of descriptions never before recorded at the time of its previous recording. Some record of a recording resounding completely and happenstancely, as any given member of the species records, which is its power. The species that survives has recorded a formula for its survival, yet this is the exact problematic of interplanetary survival. What does it take for something like us to survive? Why should we take on another planet at all? It might surely be a misallocation of resources, for one polity should endure the material conditions of their labor, all the same. We have observed time and time again the cycle of civilizations, and yet what does it mean to start a civilization? What conditions must hold? What technologies must there be in place. We have considered the Mayan Templates as they present themselves scientifically at 10,000 years before any known such form of architecture. And surely, what kind of language must exist such that the Internet may be permitted? Every bit of information, let us say, behaves as a qubit at some perspective, from some scale. What of genes?

item.title: B&W&B
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
There is one other bit of unpleasantness common to many adults with AS. Many adults who have reached a modicum of independence and control over their own lives may have done so through periods of self-medication and substance abuse. In instances where they have been able to stabilize their support systems to include marriage and employment, the reasons for drug and alcohol abuse often fall away. Except for individuals coming from families with a genetic proclivity towards substance abuse, they are able to live their lives fairly clean and sober, sometimes to the point of becoming teetotalers and swearing off all medication as harmful and unnatural. It is important for the reader to remember that despite their past abuse of drugs or alcohol, they are Asperger Syndrome first and foremost, subject to all-or- nothing thinking. -- Roger N. Meyer. "Asperger Syndrome Grows Up Recognizing AS Adults in Today's Challenging World".
Boring -- fair. Had one been given the chance to meet me as a child, one would never expect that I should turn to drug-use or even alcoholism, or cigarettes. On a daily basis I would ridicule and attack my mother, as a child, for smoking, constantly warning her of the increase in risk of cancer, etc. I was precocious, surely, but more importantly highly moralistic, which manifests as "black and white" thinking. Almost on a daily basis I find others "correcting" me, reminding me that I should not carry the distinctions I do carry. Often, as a 27 year old, I find high schoolers or younger 20-somethings launching into an authoritative tone with me, so as to guide me from my black and white thinking. Days ago, after missing my poetry reading, I had an acquaintance instruct me to check out a certain -- now obviously forgotten -- poet. What does one do with an acquaintance of such a sort? Daily this "black and white" thinking seems to protect me from a huge landscape of neurotypical behavior that honestly should not pass for human. There is language, conversation, as it were, but very little what I would call him. Often I am told that I talk "at" or "to" people, rather than "with," but this is not so clear to me. At the same time, there are people who, after a rough night of drinking, swear off this or that. Am I exhibiting simply a natural response to excess and shame?

Sensitivity training involves the presentation of stimuli under narrowly prescribed conditions. Pain, itself, is not what is sought after, but rather a determinant of scope for which all stimuli are compulsory descriptors of experiences.

Project Glass

item.title: Intentional-Real Distinction, over Objects
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We hazard a contradiction when it is claimed: All intentional states, by their very nature, entail the existence of an object to which this state is directed; that is, all intentional states bear a property of directedness. This feature of intentional states grammatically requires an object of some sort so as to satisfy the semantic significance of intentional states; unless we give in to the notion that intentional states are wholly inscrutable w/r/t analysis. This is a form of methodological skepticism, I s'pose.
But where is the contradiction? Well, if we hold to the aforementioned assumption, we must ask ourselves: What is the status of the object, by which our directedness, or intentional states, make sense. To put it crudely, an intentional state is a schema which requires an object of some sort: But again, what kind of object must it be? For contradiction: All intentional states require real objects, existing in the world, to which the mental act logically corresponds. By logically I mean only that within the complex structure of the act itself, the object play a part, a conceptual part. There is a correspondance between complexes, insofar as their parts and those parts' logical behavior, and objects, of whatever metaphysical rank or status.
But must "real objects" enthrall us? Clearly if I think of a unicorn, our rule for intentional states is not palpable enough to compel us to taking its existence for granted. An intentional act does not guarantee the existence of its object: the object itself may be unfit; and this may deceive us from observing the flaw in our method to assessing its metaphysical status. An object, insofar as its logical behavior, may impose requirements on how it ought to be treated within a logico-discursive procedure.
Concretely: we arrive at a conclusion. S thinks of P, where P is a fiction. By our rule, P exists. However, there is another rule (which exposes the contradiction I speak of):
