item.title: "What's that IP address again?"
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: "I don't need the Internet." -- It's true. Most people could get by on their phones. We've emancipated them enough to understand how to leech, like we sometimes do. And we're telling them there's a cyberwar. Just another war. A country decayed from the dogmatic conviction to foregone wars on opaque metaphors. Now we're telling people to protect themselves lest we become their daily tech support -- "What's that IP address again?" "iP, that's something Steve Jobs did, right?" The perception of the industries closely affiliated or indeed dependent on the Internet will change. And no one is emotionally or economically prepared. Rather, they are terrified. Network-style terror from the left; Stalinist terror from the right; and Obama has a handsome wife.

item.title: This is a hyperlink:
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This is a hyperlink: ❮a❯Hey. Hi. Hello.❮/a❯ It's got two parts: hyperlink and hypertext. We've become used to the idea that the world is unified in some way: reality is thus, and so private life is thus. That is the way it has always been. If it were not this way, I doubt I would be able to understand any of it for very long. Reality: By its very notion there is a degree of it presented, regardless of what anyone may call it. "The subconscious", "one's mental life"; from a certain perspective, all is merged into the fuzzy picture often recognized: this is Reality. But indeed: the hyperlink is in fact two. What is more, the hyperlink is not. We have built our lives around the assumption that the hyperlink is one. We have shared links, and given ourselves unto complexity. Now, two worlds exist: the world of links and the world of our rhetoric around those links. And then again, there is one's human organism. Imagine: Every word you share makes a connection. Imagine the language of your links. It's the new hand grenade. You can @style it up or @rel it to the rest of the bunker. You can give it secret @titles to speak to those just enough observant, or make it speak a different @lang. It's @href is a bit like magic. And wizards have been discovering wonderful things with it, on the #, on the http, in mailto:, even apps depend on it since they depend on the #. And links come of very many @types. The link is a tool. A tool that can be abused, limited by human bondage. Information wants to be Free. Whence comes the Link?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Tipler's Omega Point.

item.title: Ladies, the Logos ain't out to get you
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Sure, Liz Lemon is my hero, too, but that's because she's funny. (Though she's a woman through a lens: the lens of the comedic tradition. It's a support system. A community. Historically indebted, etc.) This: https://heartiste.wordpress.com/2010/09/13/the-problem-with-women-is-too-much-self-esteem/ and many articles like it are expressing something close to a few of my own observations.
"What kind of woman do you get when you combine a cultural apparatus designed to maximally extol the virtues of womanhood and cast all fault for any female shortcomings on male bias and discrimination with a biologically innate evolutionary imperative that renders men more expendable than women? Answer: A woman with a big fat head."
And then there's the "analytic philosophy" bashing crowd. I have no idea why this has become a thing. But I've met too many alt-grrls (and oddly enough hyper-christian women) who get their jollies on bashing "analytic philosophy" through some short-sighted, cursory reading of, say, logical positivism. Or Continentals "get" femininity. They ultimately end up bashing straw-men but the result is a sophomore philosopher's dreams somehow forced and re-framed into the rampant pointlessness of gendered-thought such that his chances at scoring become a category mistake. I recall once sitting through a impromptu, 20-30 minute conversation, lord help me, where after confessing that I studied philosophy at an analytic school, with a Woody Allen-esque self-deprecating joke, my female counterpart managed to wrangle the entire conversation into sweeps and sweeps of generalizations about the bankruptcy of "analytic" thought. However, every point was tinged with: "Well, why are guys this way?" Most (bias!) left-leaning women seem to be shouting up front: this Analytic philosophy is a boy's club! And then the theory begins on why this is the case. It certainly is true, statistically, but no one made it that way. All that realist hubris (especially my own) aside, the point is: How has it come about that systems-thinking, translation homework, "logical thinking" (as dictated by an academic textbook on logic -- maybe I should've used "rational?"), and all that are vices? Now one must avoid philosophy on pain of automatically positioning oneself as antagonistic to a wealth of feminist topics, for one, that one isn't even initiated on. We have to start with Plato. We have to start with Anaximander, Thales, the Sages, whatever Nietzsche said, etc. We have to start somewhere. It cannot all be male-infused wankery. This kind of skepticism is too big to be palatable. Ladies, the Logos ain't out to get you. Coincidentally, analytic philosophers are the arbiters of the "analytic" here in the West, and so the entire skit seemed as if an opportunity to explore the many ways in which one could cockblock a budding upstart in philosophy. Sure, some of it was personal for her part, perhaps: but why? I have a handful of experiences like this. And it's most undesirable to have to explain, "Oh yes. I studied analytic philosophy, and yes I do think religious studies, cultural anthropology, gender analysis, social justice, etc., etc., .etc are viable research categories." -- "Oh, sorry. I used the word 'categories' -- sue me?" Political correctness has gone ape. Cannibalistic ape. It's unclear to me how being fascinated with symbol pushing MUST entail that one buys the whole "logos-patriarchy" stuff. Thus logicians become meek and lovers of silence, while the riotgrrl/pomo/post-mod/etc femme fatales attack them for implicitly inseminating their symbols with patriarchal semantics. Of course, it isn't surprising. Look at the playboyism of existentialism, the flurry and fray of dadaism and the Beats. And a mess of non-academic lines of thought, blended with the enemy. Now it is fashionable to despise the most mystic of mystics on account that, well, something stuff-white-people-like might say, or an A Softer World one-liner.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Twenty thumbs up for the title line.

item.title: Political Atheism
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I'm glad there's a phrase for it. It should be obvious. I've personally been in a political lag. I blame Texas, but I don't have to. Now, of course, I feel a low-grade, persistent burning in my heart. It's been there since I woke this morning, and I went to sleep with it. I suppose it is the expression of pain, "Fuck you!" (Not fuck this.) What sparked this is an innocent question of "Well, are you going to vote?" Indeed? Moroccans (3) are burning themselves alive in protest to unemployment. America is everywhere. So again, fuck you. I've just learned that Jobs was outsourcing slave labor in China to produce a fucking iPad I just purchased unwittingly. I've seen enumerable patrons of this product. No wonder they've declared war. Apple just noted its quarterly. They apparently have $100bn cash-in-hand. Their profits put Google's revenue to shame. Not one person is aware of the numerous potential cures for cancer since, well, what people in the upper-crusts of society know is that one simply doesn't "cure cancer." Now I'm aware of four techniques/drugs that remember what cancer looks like and enhances the body, in a way, with an artificially supported immune system. There are like 4 of these techniques now. Some of them are in drug trials. Imagine if they had more funding and the news actually reported the research coming University of Alberta or the hospital trials in Buffalo, NY. Our current president signed the National Defense Authorization Act (#ndaa), and people look at me as if I'm trying to express my wit and intellect to vocalize a clever acronym. They feel I'm trying to best them, usually. Competitive fucking Americans. Or like I'm speaking a different language. "O hay the guy with dreadlocks is telling me I haven't been politically aware enuff." Fuck you. Of course, people should be in absolute terror. But no. In October, some asshole introduced the Enemy Expatriation Act. It's brief. The idea is to establish guidelines for depriving U.S. denizens of their nationality. Of course, it's just a bunch of jargon for regular people. Then there's SOPA/PIPA/ACTA. My school's newspaper published an article a day after a massive 10,000 website-strong protest (100,000 if you count social justice nods, or simply posts) which didn't even mention the other two, after SOPA. For whatever reason, people still think news under the traditional format, counts. I cannot wait to slap a newspaper out of some poor twit's grip. Most of this town ain't even aware that OPEN Act was passed, what, a few days ago? And the European Union is going to vote on ACTA today (or so we're told). And here I am, all this tragic news, and Americans want to know: Who will save us this time? Jumping from one hero to the next, one political bed to the next. The question was innocent because the person didn't know me very well. Fine. But really? Now Romney is the hot ticket. Fuck you. But here's the kicker. I'm an anarchist. I've been an anarchist for as long as I remember. I flirted with some queer combination of Marxism, but that is because this country is an installation of capitalism. Marxism is the critique of capitalism. I become "Marxist" so long as I become unsettled by tragic outcomes uniquely the result of capitalism. But now, of course, capitalism is not the issue. This country is fascist.  Look, I've never voted. I realized Bush would win while I was in an arcade, as countless of my "level-headed" friends rambled on about their disdains, while supporting themselves with justifications for why the world must be the way it is. It's bullshit. Americans, for the most part, are bullshitters. I've seen enough pragmatism to know now that my dogmatic, hostile, bigotry will serve me well. I am not an American. Even technically speaking, I am not an American. You actually cannot convince me, a person of African-descent of this. I am diaspora. I do not have the "problem" of: "But you're surrendering your values!" I am not an American. This country is only nearly 9 times older than I am. And now its president strikes fear without merit or warrant into countless peoples' lives. And your bullshit country is barely over 200 years old. Who the fuck are you? Your fucking motto is "In God We Trust." Fuck you. Your country is trash. I knew this from the outset, and it's easy to convince jaded Americans that you're on their side. They just want the personal affectations. Confirmation of self-worth, and all that narcissistic bullshit. And sex. Copious quantities of fucking sex. Now I'm to believe I have neuroses when in truth, I'm just a fucking overly empathetic, impressionable person who got toss into the cesspool of American consumerism, greed and mismanagement of everything within arm's reach. Who's to blame? Fuck you. Don't tell me I'm a fucking American. Your country is trash. Hell, trash is more relevant than this bloatocracy. (Back in 2007, I had similar anxieties, tritely expressed.) I do not vote. And fuck you if you think I'm some public intellectual who knows better. Go read and article before you approach me with your fashionable liberal politics.

item.title: SOPA Template for Web Developers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: When your site goes up, I will not be putting my name, or company, or a colophon that identifies myself. Moreover, please do not inform others of who developed it. I am not "open for business," as it were. In a sense, consider yourself my last public client. I'm fairly confident maintaining your site will be personally manageable for both your part and my part, since it is running on Wordpress which is a beautifully orchestrated content management system. I would prefer to continue to ensure that it runs efficiently as the product I've handed off to you. This, of course, does not entail novel or "interesting" new development. In another sense, you are not my client, the site is. I do not believe what I'm saying here opens a channel for communication between us about "maintenance" in the usual sense of the word. By "maintenance" I mean simply what I define as maintenance: that the site actually is running, it runs optimally, has proper database backups, and doesn't subject you to undue liability (considering the recent events of NDAA, SOPA, PIPA, ACTA, and the OPEN Act). If you haven't been following these bits of legislation, that doesn't really matter. And it is not my job to educate you on them. But one thing you must understand is that the U.S. government has made the ownership and development of a website a severe liability to citizens and non-citizens alike. So, in truth, as your name is on the Registrar ticket, you need to properly educate yourself on the guidelines and recent developments of ICANN and the European Union's ACTA guideline (which seems to contain by some interpretations potentially binding laws). Of course, it is a trade agreement, not law. Very soon the concept of a TLD (top level domain; .com, .org., .net) will change radically, and possibly such that it will be an exorbitant cost to continue to own a TLD. (This is why domains like .xxx and .info and so on are cropping up. Imagine that ".com" is for Fox news and company while ".info" is for your local community kiosk and ".personal" for your personal Website.) Please do not take this as "political discourse." I am informing you as a Web Developer whose job it is to ensure that clients are able to enter a market largely supported by other developers, computer scientists, etc. Surely, whatever lookslike interpretation or mere opinion or what have you in the above paragraphs, you can take with a grain of salt. I personally am still trying to understand most of what is going on with all of this legislation, and obviously I have not read all of it. I do have a day job, etc. Of course, at any moment should you wish that I "hand over the keys," please do not hesitate to say so.

A law we can fight. We cannot fight an "agreement" to be crooked. Governments haven't been a Real Thing since Reagan. Now we're just fighting corporatocracies. item.title: Yet another rant about #sopa
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: It's great how so many of my liberal and moderate friends have caved to the fear of ACTA, SOPA and all that. It's wonderfully twisted bifurcation which leaves me feeling hollow, worthless, and wholly insignificant. I'm not sure who my friends are anymore. As far as I can tell, I'm just a deranged kid who spends way too much time on the Internet, who's fun to poke every once and a while. Once the Internet comes under attack, everybody realizes they aren't much of liberal-minded folks anyway. So it's a question of "is free speech worth fighting for?" or "is [Internet] free speech worth fighting for?" Losing Internet free-speech is like being told, "You cannot download this onto this device" for most people. "Oh well." Fantastic. 20,000 strong marching in Poland, and this is what I have to work with. </hand-holding> l33ch 0ff t3h Free software m0vement sum moar przz; przz be fashionably 0pen src 4 me (these arguments are old; older than your oldest hip install of Ubuntu) Most people simply say, "Oh well, it's too much for me!" Everybody searching for heroes, slapping, even further, down all the existential false-positive howls of Satre, etc., etc., etc., the Beats, all the Mystics. Now people are praying for a climate where they can be comfortable in their house-dogmatism. And I wonder why I just spent 2 hours explaining any of it. "That's over my head, man! You fight that fight." Cheers, /me slapped in the face yet ago. (And my friends wonder why I'm pissed, with bullshit psychoanalysis. No, you broke my heart by giving up your country. You know who you are, if this applies to you, and you know the only thing I want is to hit that trigger and get you hot. Let yr self-esteem fill in the rest. I'll be focusing on trying to keep yr Facebooks goin'. And cheering on isn't support. Learn how to sshtunnel, motherfucker.)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Yes. I pray every morning, afternoon, and midnight for an ice age. I'm sick of hearing computers howl. I want wolves, gargantuan ice-hawks, child eating owls, sabertooth rabbits: the real deal!

item.title: The Reading Web
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: How does one mitigate the problems of information overconsumption, overload, etc? Browse the Web. Go to the website. Immerse yourself in the design. Like learning how to read a new book -- each different, in size, weight, texture, aroma, typesetting, feel and ergonomic, care, handling, age, etc. You'll "slow down" (rhythmetize) at yr own pace.

item.title: The Indivisibility of Content
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
A core challenge in realizing these privacy benefits without compromising privacy in other respects is awareness. The content an individual provides that drives their self-representation must be provided with their awareness and understanding of how the aggregation of data contributes as a whole to their online representation. This is particularly challenging for personalized online services with which an individual may not immediately understand the perspective of others viewing them through personalized services. — Vanity or Privacy? Social Media as a Facilitator of Privacy and Trust. Feb 2012. Jessica Staddon. Google.
My original position is that one cannot die assuming that one has produced sufficient complexity. With user-generated content, these information tycoons (Google, etc.) depend on us for discovery. We are obviously concerned with the inner workings of ourselves. Autism/Asperger's suggests the naturally (neurologically) engineered acceptance of personal introspection. The capacity for openness without anxiety, but given the appropriate context for expression. That one should express and that the actual description in question be of the relevant kind of evidence. One does not realize the very real story one tells when they browse the Web. Each Web site keeps an actual .log of hits, but no one cares to store all that data. For Website Analytics, not invading your privacy is a decision we indirectly make because to do so is a practical storage problem. "We don't really care to know why they hit the site, anyway. We assume it's for the content." If one has too much content, one engenders "noise." One builds a shroud of semantic gunk to shield one's self, for if it is presumably all valid "for me," in that it is my opinion, what can one do but review it all? The slow process of close and critical perception. Index me. You'll see nothing with your hands full.

item.title: anon-
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: *Anonymous* means the web is filled with anonymous profiles which use some permutation of the syntactic construction "Anonymous". So, its semantic meaning is diffused through the actual quantification over all agent-messages which bear the name "Anonymous". The name is both vague and exact insofar as a total quantification of Internet communication. (Default) "Anonymous" profiles and (Intentionally Chosen) "Anonymous" profiles stand side by side. This is what is meant by "Expect us." Who sets default identity positions on the Web? The ones who log in to the servers, and prepare the dotfiles and the .conf files? The structure of the Web, the Internet, is built around anonymity. One cannot name the default user, "Steve". The problem starts again: "stevenymous". Akin to Cantor's Proof, "we do not forget" (the convergence of cognitive limit and anti-diagonal). Follow-up: http://canopycanopycanopy.com/15/our_weirdness_is_free

item.title: Bookchin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
To barge into this revolutionary development with the worn recipes of Marxism, to babble about a "class line" and the "role of the working class," amounts to a subversion of the present and the future by the past. To elaborate this deadening ideology by babbling about "cadres," a "vanguard party," "democratic centralism" and the "proletarian dictatorship" is sheer counterrevolution. It is to this matter of the "organizational question " - this vital contribution of Leninism to Marxism - that we must now' direct some attention.
1. To the annals of Humean banter. 2. The myth of the past: content of the mode of production. 3. The lack of a causally efficient language: the induction of privacy follows from the measure of consistency of all causally efficacious languages. A proletarian must revolt through the shedding of classical language. The language of revolt as organic armament.

item.title: #marijuana
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
(C)annabinoids have displayed a great potency in reducing glioma tumor growth. (They) appear to be selective antitumoral agents as they kill glioma cells without affecting the viability of nontransformed counterparts. — Expert Review of Neurotherapeutics
A reader of the Huffington Post writes:
There are many, many medical applications for marijuana. My husband has myotonic muscular dystrophy, at times his hands cramp up so bad he cannot let go of things or he cannot take hold of things. He has had a medical marijuana card for years, when he smokes it or vaporizes it, it relieves these symptoms for him. It is useful for many other applications as well, chronic pain, nausea, dizziness, appetite booster and on and on. It is sinful that more people are not allowed the use of a medicine that is naturally helpful for so many different ailments. — @user Koa, What Your Government Knows About Cannabis And Cancer — And Isn't Telling You
I have gone to jail for having in my possession a drug that helps human beings who suffer from certain pains, like myotonic muscular dystrophy. I went to jail for a drug that helps people, and I paid money out of my own pocket so that I could secure my own freedom. I went to jail, the facts being as they are. Why should I be morally admonished by the State because the State cannot figure out how to introduce this herb into its market. I was throw in jail on account of a poverty of the economist's imagination. Not only am I expected to pay taxes. But, what is more, I am expected to pay for the failures of this country's economic positioning and lack of foresight.

Personally?

One day, I tried to self-medicate. I had two major toothaches which I could only resolve through financial means. I worked. I worked, and paid taxes. I worked hard, sometimes ruining my own personal health for my project, my employer, my colleagues, the "design," the "client." Sometimes, this herb makes it incredibly easy to focus, to focus on my project, my employer, my colleagues, the "design," the "client." And sometimes this herb minimized the pain. I was arrested at a private park by a "patrol" cop who is part of a private organization that largely exists through donation of the private owners of that park. I was arrested for possession of an herb that is widely deployed and dispersed throughout the community around that private park. His sincere justification, after I plead to him how his arrest might affect me? -- "It's fine in your home, but you're out here!" -- The private park of connoisseurs de arte in the middle of a slowly decaying hippie community in Texas. : Yes. Fuck that. Fuck you. Fuck everything. I will walk the middle of the street. I will kick in your headlight. I will blow up your house. I will take your device. I will vote for you. I will corrupt your children. Mangez-vous tet. Burn your taxes. Post your anti-human flyers. Fight your dog for a day. Tell your grandmother about emptiness on the deathbed in a public hospital. I do not want happiness for humanity. I do not want joy for any person. I want noise. I want drugs. And I want to build. I want to build these things into you. In the words of a great web meme: I am drugs. (TAKE.) Indeed, a unique, inviting feature of the community, that which attracts youth, upstarts, left-leaning apologists, etc., is that the herb is so highly regarded. Friendships and community are built around the presence of this herb. And I was arrested, in the heart of the community, that park, for possessing it. For possessing an herb that I assumed was helping me "cope." I was arrested while I had nearly 9 work projects at Waste Management and at least 10 personal projects, all dealing with codebases. These are facts about a person who lives in the United States. I exist. People, like me, exist. U.S. government: You are ruining not only this economy, but the core value-set that sustains whatever this ad hoc culture has to its merit. U.S. government: You are a failure and a disservice to humanity. And now I am to understand that you have undertaken "offensive operations" in the domain of my work, the Internet. Honestly, what the hell do you expect from me? Seriously, Obama, please answer me this fucking question: What the fuck am I supposed to do in a country this blatantly hostile to people like me? -- "Potential Indicators of Terrorist Activities at Internet Cafes"? Seriously? Like, are you assuming I'm illiterate or something? How in fuck's sake is it that adult human beings are authoring garbage like this? And you're signing this garbage? [Ah, side rants.] STOP fucking me over. And stop trying to argue me out of my hard earned money with your bogus laws, legal taboos, bourgeois catch-22s, hocus-pocus politics, and bureaucratic sleight of hand. I am a human being god dammit. I do not deserve to have my life confounded by the rancorous attitude of a mismanaged War State. And now you want to demonstrate the qualities a prefascist government? At some point, one has only one thing that one can say, "I did not sign up for this." Stop doing these things and acknowledge the reality of the country you live in.

item.title: Woman as Activity
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
"Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upwards."
As Eve demonstrates the first expression of toil by taking of the tree. Not born, but created, and as yet to manifest or encapsulate an entire domain of human experience: motivation. And what's more, motivation only exploitable, it seems, by interest in the intellect.
One might call it a by-product of anti-intellectualism, any form of misogyny from Christina thought. Moreover, the Goddess is always the student, the serpent, the Inquisitor, in some fashion or other, in pagan cultures. Witches were, in fact, burn'd for speculation to feats of science, unexplainable by theological yet it was condemned as morally incompatible with the metaphysical tenets of theology. With no substantive or quantitative thinking at all! No utilitarian thinking! Simply women exploiting the "laws of nature" as the laws of nature defined by Orthodox metaphysics. _Behind that_ there is the underlying question of the necessary quality of the world, insofar as it must be, for any feat of witchcraft to hold: we would have to admit the ignorance of science _as accepted_! Better to preserve that than admit the scientific commitments of the church. Nevertheless, what was "heretical" was the _proletarian scientist as woman_: a tinkerer of the economic status quo through a liberatory mode of thought. Whatever truth holds to witchcraft it amounts to the woman as a manipulator of "trouble," and in a sense an undertone of anxiety toward what is woman: that it is not man. And that man is born unto that which the woman weaves.
By the scripture, we must question what "woman" is "born unto," if anything at all. A close-friend asserts, in absurd jest, as I jerked that it was unimaginable that he should have a mother at all, "I punched my way through non-existence." By the scripture, "woman" is in a certain sense "removed" from the cycle of birth, and in essence is the product of creativity and action. The document enshrines a metaphysic: woman follows from activity.
And yet woman is condemned by following the dictates of her nature. Her elixir: understanding. That her weakness should be empathy for understanding.

item.title: Systematically Misinforming Agents
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In response to: Net on Fire [pencil illustration of Internet Explorer icon "e" recently set aflame with match from a "SOPA"-labeled matchbook] Oh my god. At best Micosoft was conflicted over the specific SOPA document, but expressed interest in seeing it revised. Your graphic here so utterly misinforms the reader and regular citizen on so many levels it is a disastrous and irresponsible act. It is a shame that Daily Cougar policy might involve that debate correspond to the continued existence of this artwork. And flavors and style of argument paying homage to religious persecution and political freedom of speech will be the facade and shroud of validity presumably underpinning the artwork. When simply put it is radically idiotic. That is simply what it is. The stupidity of the browser wars back again. The big blue "e" in large part caused this mess. By hindering the rate of technological development, by going to war with Netscape, Firefox, Webkit, open source browsers and free browsers. And all the free software that comes with developing browser extensions. Instead, Microsoft primarily enabled the market of anti-virus software and "firewalls." To generate revenue for hardware manufacturers. And this stuff hardly enriches anyone's life in any meaningful sense. Most respond, "WTF is a router? A fire-what?" Microsoft enabled that schisms in our understanding of technology. This company engendered a climate of fear and reaction either through the unsophisticated release of the browser helper object system, or by sheer bad security practice. Whatever the case, Microsoft is no martyr. In no way should Microsoft stand for the loser here. This graphic totally ignores history of anti-trust against Microsoft, that the battle was over IE appearing on desktops and throttling the market in their favor. This graphic fails to acknowledge an entire era of technology, and fails to say the right this. It is a tragedy that it should exist in a system of culture that blindly endorses any quality of thing for the sake of expression itself. That it must express itself blindly and without apology. Perhaps this is the way things must be. That second-class citizenship should come to technology. Even our plight, as developers of IE, Opera, Firefox, mobile, etc. Builders of the Web: that such a graphic as this should exist, which totally fails to capture any truth on the way the world was and is today. The graphic is a complete lie, and fails to successfully communicate any truth except the capacity for the author's ignorance, surely enough, in the midst of the war itself. A war which, certainly enough, Microsoft helped obscure and screen with anti-intellectualism through mass production and questionable software development practices. In any event, we win: That graphic loses. It is a complete fail whale. It is sad that no one at this news organization sees this. And they won't. People who build the web should be absolutely in shock. This graphic is like putting Hitler on the Cross. It is "Elizabeth Stanton" in interracial porn. It is a jew eating six pounds of ice cream. It is a fresco of the gaping, burning, smoldering holes of the remains of the twin towers representing a power outlet. It is an ex-black panther taking a shit in "Fountain" for the first surreality photography remix of Found Antique Efficiency. The Universe just took a shit on me. (I cannot make this shit up.)

item.title: Usually, It Is More Fun to Compute
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We are at the tape. Imagine a culture devoted not only to its own machinations, but machination, automation, meditation, in itself. In no other place does "cowboy" or "hypercritical Marxist social deviant" or or "cognitive enhancer" ("cog druggie", it'll make sense when we get there) or "phenomenological investigator" on and on, and then "Hacker" constitute social schema. This world has realized its function, yet it would be folly to blame or lament the machine. The Web is a draft for culture. In it, from its linguistic axioms and rules for mutation, modation, motivation, modulation on and on, real communities will undertake formation and emergence of self, identity and whole. Real communities, vying for resources, will witness pause, a kind of invert'd Babylon, wherein silence becomes a key. A world of languages we must understand as an ecological parameter which must be tweaked. Bloody fuck you, that Text is still on a Page! Even my brethren acknowledge the Rule and Stead, the Storm and Stress of existence. No matter how small, We are material things. : And so we respect the idea of ramadan prayer kabbalalalah troublesome. But we express these ideals, and these organic traditions, and we work. : We do not eat, yet it is more fun to compute. Like music. Like the other thing you do. It is felt in the fingers, and in the mind.

item.title: Post-mania
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Occupy the post. Occupy the church. Occupy the water system. Hack your family. Hack your most immediate past. Hack yourself. Yes, again: fuck everything. Why? I think I just blew my economy subwoofer. A speaker fell. And you're a fucking passive worm. A fucking pissant worm. Imagine you, a turtle with no fucking $hell. Yeesss. I did that too. Fuck you. And everything. Enough jokes. Enough of the rote. I will blow up your house, a revival I hope.

item.title: Humanmedia
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Let me enter your hackers' space. I will find in you an infinite playlist. I will show you hypermedia. What is the grammar of this architecture? _I_ am a virus, of the Web.

item.title: This.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cognitive-behavioral therapy is based on the idea that our thoughts cause our feelings and behaviors, not external things, like people, situations, and events. The benefit of this fact is that we can change the way we think to feel / act better even if the situation does not change.
Who cares about the fucking source? Read it twice if fucking necessary. How does anyone take anyone else seriously anymore?

item.title: Cartesians
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: One of the most interesting features of humanity is that death fits. What most people mean when they discuss the concept of mortality is that death makes sense for something like us. It should seem unimaginable that the experiences of any one of us could enable one to transgress the physical laws which structure our material existence. Surely, eternal life must be something over and above the organic, for what is imagined fades, and all the limitations of the mind. And even to today Cartesian banter makes sense. An idea quite pernicious yet clear, distinct.

item.title: Be analyzed
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In response to the notion: Be hated. Why respond to it? When should one respond to it? In truth, it reeks of nihilistic propaganda. So in the most abstract way, it's difficult, tenuous, anti-tangible nonsense. In conversation, it's the dejected platitude; in business, now today, no longer the sensationalist con conservative, it is new revenue fulcrum parlance. Politically under-utilized developers qua workers, underprompted, underestimated subjects of the general purpose-network have been baptized as the new laborer on which capitalistic and socialistic, indeed all political theories describe theories of polity. And this might be New Black rhetoric. Let me tell you something, -- As they might boldly say. Being hated was engineer'd, in you, brotha. Look at how we in the upper crust of the black community employ affirmative action, the eternal power grab manifesto, enshrined in legal papers and contract negotiations. In everyday conversation, it is stigma. It isn't funny. It can't be, as the history of africa re-emerges biologically. Some point must exist where genetic traits tend to prevail. The slave trade has been culturally desensitized as it has become subsumed to the war of political economy. It's Earthshakers and Black Sheep -- -- Nevertheless, evolution plays fairly, routinely, as if a regular sweep. The flap of a wing describes the width of culture. Hand a block of Lego to other species, and they might see a civilization. Why not? What indeed is analysis? -- These blacks here in the states gradually sustain'd a trend to consumerism. It's just another mode of content. Now today, in 2012, developers see the utility in contracted humility, unabash'd presentation, ostentation of intellect, and the robe of the Black Sheep. Affirmative action, for blacks, codified legally a disposition to their issues; now today, developers do this for theirs. Indeed, Reddit appear'd blackface on Bloomberg. Call this a defense: What indeed is analysis? What are ethnic qualities, and how might we consider them as points of contingency through which we might determine economic predictions? That is: Does the analogy fit, or not? I'll call the black out a disgrace. Predictable. I call it a new black. Everyone is saying it, so let's own it. Hacker, Cracker, Blacker. Again, I am a virus.

item.title: Content be not
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Our problem is that no one understands evolution. So all the fucking talk about metanarratives and their adoption is obviously hocus-pocus bullshit. The Logos, the Philos, the subconscious lullabies that drift into every conversation, the whispers of archaic archetypes, the rabble of analytic pseudo-investigation/dividedby/contigenital linguistiquation. Fuck you. Psychologists are the first to hit the wall, obviously. No one understands what the philosopher is saying, and the poor association in the public's perception of the two leaves us demanding philosophical rigor from an inadequate science de rigueur. Psychology has been abandoned for decades, actually. What we've realized is that no science is worth doing. Automation wins again. Soon when I say I can automate that one will get the gist. This type of talk will be run-of-the-mill, facon de parler, shoppetalk, common parlance, ordinary language, blah blah blahs, and certainly non-sensationalist. Will you fucking understand, or will you remain jobless in a world of machines? (Fancy that, even a machine is better than you. As 3D printers come to fruition, you kiddos who disdain argumentative discourse will come to see why it is so important. Our means for production are losing risk even in market scenarios, and they are widely deployable, as means for production. Like apache webservers, which are used to build the Web, devices like 3D printers enable certain types of economic decisions, like whether or not one should hire you or prepare a shop that centers on the existence of a fashionable, technosthetic. This is why old fashion'd coffeeshops like my own disapprove of e-cigarettes inside. It's not good for you if the government wants to enable these policies for economic-governance faster than you are given time to adapt to the machine.) Our intelligence demands zero work. Will you get that? This is what separates us from animals. Evolution demands that the species which can cheat work (labor) for its survival, that species transcends all environments (contexts) for survival. The environment determines a range of work scenarios. Survival does not necessitate environment though if environment is given, survival deterministically follows work scenarios (ends, telos, the modal expression of attribute). The assumption is that the smart survive is a fact of nature. That's why psychologists started calling their ideas facts. People buy this. Look at you. Your comfortable ego now nested in swathes of psychological gunk, thick in an industry that is authority-bound. And now their words and statements, loosely strung together and yet more blissfully sewn into your televisions and media stations, are your armament. In a world that is prepared to shoot ordinary language. I speak many languages beyond English, and not one of them is natural or formal. They are languages of the mind.

item.title: I have Asperger's Syndrome
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Truth be told, it's a self-diagnosis. Truth be told, I'm also not fucking illiterate, with a fucking degree in philosophy and training in advanced concepts of philosophy of mathematics and logic, Wittgenstein and a great wealth of analytic psychology and philosophy, cognitive-neuroscience, early modern philosophy. I trust my judgment. Why do I constantly find myself being intellectually belittled by people who just do not fucking know more than me on this subject, and, truth be told, on a wealth of other subjects? I mean, holy fuck. Look at the "difficulties" and ask yourself, "Do I even fucking remember the last thing he was talking about?"
Qualities  Honest Determined An expert on insects and the Titanic Aware of sounds that others cannot hear Kind Forthright A loner (and happy to be so) A perfectionist A reliable friend Good at drawing Observant of details that others do not see Exceptional at remembering things that other people have forgotten Humorous in a unique way Advanced in the knowledge of mathematics Liked by adults Difficulties Accepting mistakes Making friends Taking advice Managing my anger Handwriting Knowing what someone is thinking Avoiding being teased Showing as much affection as other family members expect Coping with sudden noises Explaining thoughts using speech
Taken from The Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome. More.
Some adolescents with Asperger’s syndrome realize they have difficulties with empathy and understanding the emotions of other people, and develop a special interest in creating situations and making statements as a ‘psychological experiment’ to be able to predict someone’s emotional reaction. The statements can be extremely disturbing for the subject in the experiment: for example, an adolescent informing his aunt, in a way that is credible, that her much-loved pet has just been killed by running in front of a passing car. The act or ‘experiment’ is malicious and intended to explore or enjoy the emotional reaction of distress or fear in someone. The subject of the experiment is unlikely to have done anything to justify an act of retaliation. The only link may be that the subject is a happy person who is successful in the areas of ability that are elusive for the person with Asperger’s syndrome. — The Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome
Remember when the agora burned down during Halloween? "How would you all feel if agora burned down?" (To a group of 10+ 20-somethings, bearing in mind my adoration for the coffee shoppe.) -- Great. I'm glad I got that figured out. Prepare to get axed. I'm getting fucking sick of being exploited/manipulated based on the fact that I don't look autistic.
Hans Asperger, who published a pioneering account of autism in 1944, remarked on the ethereal beauty of his patients almost as if it were a diagnostic symptom.
No, that last joke isn't because I'm the token black guy and I'm "aware" of this, as a utilitarian-capitalist (like everyone assumes, including political theorists — oh my!), in this post-modern, post-colonial, post-colloquial, post-compassionate, post-scarcity-nigh-post-apocalyptic power-gestalt you call "civilization." It's because I'm the token Aspie that you failed you recognize.
I just fucking assumed I could have a conversation with a human being. (my emphasis)
Better yet: Aasimar. Yeah. I went there.

item.title: Close Your Facebook Account
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Is the Obsession with Devices a Sickness? Code outside. Always. Code monkey right? Write in a tree. In the Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome, Attwood suggests a model with which to understand the neurological story, in terms of a functionalist-position. The "social module" along with other abilities grows over time. Aspies tend to have a neurologically stunted "social module" sapling. We should extend this reasoning to the "computer as part of the human phenotype" (Pemperton). Hu-mans who tend to overuse Facebook should be viewed, as we would view an Asperger's patient, as meeting a criterion for possessing a poorly developed "computer" module. Put it this way: Some of us learn language faster than others. For some of us, it's highly interesting that we might not learn to vocalize until 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 years of age. Whatever the age, there's a cut off. Many of these hu-mans simply are not picking up. In a sense, they are along an Asperger's like spectrum where they are "blind" to their innate tech abilities. (I, for instance, can dual type at 30WPM on two standard keyboards. Why should I need this ability? -- But I have it. tpoped out vim with powerline, nerdtree, and other goodies, etc.) I mean, just take the analogy! (a general description of Asperger's):
  • A lack of social understanding [comparison: lack of tech understanding],
  • limited ability to have a reciprocal conversation [comparison: even if online, people resort too Broken 1337lish], and
  • an intense interest in a particular subject are the core features of this syndrome [comparison: meformers; they are solipsistic in a way, as if it were a fact that there's no good etiquette (no content to the concept), as some unruly Aspie kid's behavior might suggest -- except here: as if it were a fact that there's no content to claims about CISPA, NDAA, GMOs, Rick Perrying, etc. (no content to these issues since there's disproportionate growth to the "me module.")].

item.title: Cycling Self-Defense
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I am not a "cyclist." I am a person who rides a bike as my primary mode of transportation. I have no clique or gang or group. There is no "manifesto." I am person who simply chooses to ride his bike because doing so enables a kind of harmony in his body. I feel better when I ride. My breathing is better. My thinking and imagination are better.
However, drivers typically assume that I am a "cyclist." That by riding at all, I must have political interests and awareness. I am aware of the laws as they apply to me, and that is it. The "politics" is a waste of my time, just as most "drivers" overlook the politics of their primary mode of transportion. How often are you "surprised" by a raise in gas prices, or that bicycle riders in most areas are technically defined as "vehicles" by traffic law?
It doesn't make any sense when the bottom line is this: The potential for bodily harm _on_ a bicycle is greater than that of a being _in_ a car. Drivers of cars are in a _comfortable_ position to make decisions: most cyclists STRUGGLE to get to that point in their careers as "cyclists." Imagine that you are learning stick shift: Where else do you get genuine training than simply being on the road, and gaining experience through that practice? Cyclists, or bicycle riders, must gain experience on the road. Drivers should bear that in mind when they are driving, that cyclists are practicing their craft, or that cyclists are training themselves to be more cautious bicycle riders.
So many considerations are not taken by drivers of motor vehicles, such that poor etiquette and rudeness become determining factors in the _lives_ of other people. Think about this: RUDENESS is a determining factor in whether or not a cyclist encounters a wide range of types of bodily harm. Car drivers feel comfortable to "tease" cyclists or "educate" them with their cars, or to simply drive as if the cyclist only has something to learn about the "realities" of car driving. This is unacceptable. I will not be taught a lesson by some driver making comfortable decisions from their car-sofa.
Moreover, under no circumstance is it acceptable to honk at a cyclist UNLESS a driver is concerned with properly making clear that reason for which they have honked. Most drivers use horns to bring awareness to other drivers, rarely to educate, but this social function does exist. Frequently I find myself honked at, while a driver attempts to multi-task driving, putting away their currently used mobile phone all the while screaming at me through a closed window. This is unacceptable, too.
Henceforth, I will carry a (1) large knife and (2) my rope lock. If you honk at me with no genuine attempt to raise awareness to the situation (I don't see why this is necessary in the first place, no one [falls asleep at the handlebars].), or because I am riding "too slow", I will use (2), as I see fit, to bring it to your attention that you are acting inappropriately and unnecessarily. No cyclist needs a horn to be "made aware." The cyclist is attempting to be aware as possible, as they MUST be in order to operate their vehicle. Drivers have various devices and opportunity to allow their car to perform semi-automatically. THAT is why the horn exists. No such automatic feature exists for a bicycle. Horns, I repeat, do not apply to bicycles.
Henceforth, safety provisioning requires ONE (1) bike to a lane, and indeed, the center lane. If a car is legally required to take the road, then a cyclist MUST operate their vehicle in the safest possible way. By my own reasoning, this requires that AUTOMOBILES take the rightmost lane, while cyclists maintain whatever speed they see fit to ensure safe cycling to their destination IN THE CENTERMOST LANE. If drivers do not acknowledge this, they will be warned with (1) or (2) however it is best seen fit to educate them.
Drivers who intentionally flout traffic law and safety etiquette will be attacked with (1) or (2).
Other tactics for warning or bringing awareness, either in the political or in a practical, immediate scenario, may include: (3) kicking any available zone on the car, (4) flipping open (and taking) the gas tank lid, (5) paint for marking hostile drivers, (6) U-tapping (U-lock tactics), (7) bean pelting, etc.

item.title: Become a Better Writer, Dialectical Conversationalist, etc.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
1. Read "Politics and the English Language", Orwell
  2. Goto Jack Lynch's Guide to Grammar and Style
  3. Read The English Language: A User's Guide by Jack Lynch (as well)
  4. Understand Paul Grice's Conversational Maxim's: http://www.sas.upenn.edu/~haroldfs/dravling/grice.html (Understand that they are, as proffered by Grice, descriptive, partly anthropological heuristics for analysis of certain ways of talking, or façon de parler (); but they may also be developed as normative principles which may be used to constructively guide all talk exchanges.)

Fig. 1, Grice's Maxims:

The maxim of quantity, where one tries to be as informative as one possibly can, and gives as much information as is needed, and no more. The maxim of quality, where one tries to be truthful, and does not give information that is false or that is not supported by evidence. The maxim of relation, where one tries to be relevant, and says things that are pertinent to the discussion. The maxim of manner, when one tries to be as clear, as brief, and as orderly as one can in what one says, and where one avoids obscurity and ambiguity.

Fig. 2, an excerpt from J. Lynch:

##Prepositions. Prepositions are usually little words that indicate direction, position, location, and so forth. Some examples: to, with, from, at, in, near, by, beside, and above. A quick-and-dirty rule of thumb: you can usually recognize a preposition by putting it before the word he. If your ear tells you he should be him, the word might be a preposition. Thus to plus he becomes to him, so to is a preposition. (This doesn't help with verbs of action; show + he becomes show him. Still, it might help in some doubtful cases.) ##Prepositions at the End. Along with split infinitives, a favorite bugbear of the traditionalists. Whatever the merit of the rule — and both historically and logically, there's not much — there's a substantial body of opinion against end-of-sentence prepositions; if you want to keep the crusty old-timers happy, try to avoid ending written sentences (and clauses) with prepositions, such as to, with, from, at, and in. Instead of writing “The topics we want to write on,” where the preposition on ends the clause, consider “The topics on which we want to write.” Prepositions should usually go before (pre-position) the words they modify. On the other hand — and it's a big other hand — old-timers shouldn't always dictate your writing, and you don't deserve your writing license if you elevate this rough guideline into a superstition. Don't let it make your writing clumsy or obscure; if a sentence is more graceful with a final preposition, let it stand. For instance, “He gave the public what it longed for” is clear and idiomatic, even though it ends with a preposition; “He gave the public that for which it longed” avoids the problem but doesn't look like English. A sentence becomes unnecessarily obscure when it's filled with from whoms and with whiches. According to a widely circulated (and often mutated) story, Winston Churchill, reprimanded for ending a sentence with a preposition, put it best: “This is the sort of thing up with which I will not put.” [Revised 12 Jan. 2007.]
Write and talk appropriate to your audience. The most illuminating feature of the Scripture is that its author aims to speak both to the current audience and a lasting audience, regardless of its metaphysics. The Scripture has itself a Theory of Linguistic Provenance. For instance, the idea of a roll call as a perlocutionary speech act, its perlocutionary force of [having had organized or ordered history]. So, then, the Scripture, for instance, suggests to us a way for fitting names into a scientific edifice by logical presentation. The audience, then, is not simply you, but anyone who might understand the procedure of listing names in such a fashion, as more, such that the text [makes sense]. What is important here is the [maxim of manner] and the [maxim of quantity], the author writes for, in principle, all audiences, from a presentation of a finite number. Is the speaker [successful]? Your audience in some cases might be your self. Determine what criteria you demand for a successful "talk exchange" such that shared knowledge may be produced, rather than actionable results (we should ignore implementation details).

item.title: "How can you have Asperger's? I'm 'zany' too!"
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Commonality and the Myth of Diagnosis

Another unusual feature of conversations is a tendency to make what appear to be irrelevant comments. A statement or question can be made that is not obviously linked to the topic of conversation. These utterances can be word associations, fragments of the dialogue of previous conversations or seemingly quite bizarre utterances. It appears that the child says the first thought that comes to mind, unaware how confusing this can be for the other person. The reason for this feature remains elusive but may be associated with a tendency to be impulsive and less able to formulate a logical structure or sequence for the statement or description, and an inability to consider the perspective of the other person. When this occurs, you are unsure whether to respond to the irrelevant comment or continue the conversation as if it had not occurred. I tend to ignore such comments and focus on the central theme of the conversation. — The Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome, Tony Attwood
Many of my "close" friends have rejected the idea that I have Asperger's Syndrome. Since I'm young-looking and attractive it's manifest to the layperson that someone like me cannot have Asperger's Syndrome. (It is not a choice; it is a genetic social disorder and neurological outlier which must be observed. Observed. -- Observed. Observation Statements Must Be Produced Which Align with the Generic Psychological Profile. I will type it again. Observation Statements Must Be Produced Which Align with the Generic Psychological Profile. Profiles can be differentiated. That is, they do not exist in a vacuum.) One issue with many of these people is their own insecurities: they think that if someone has Asperger's Syndrome, they must be of the Newton or Einstein sort. Or Daniel Johnston sort. Yes, the one or two anecdotes that make up your knowledge of these peoples' lives are myopic, insufficient, etc. for any genuine talk on Asperger's to be had. If anecdotal evidence is all we have to go on, and meager evidence at that, hearsay if you will, then we might as well talk shoppe about reality TV. Most people simply have no idea of how diagnostic medicine works, so they are incapable of constructive talk on the topic; them, I dismiss.

The Game of Me

But some people know me too well. They know I enjoy playing a game called "Nonsense" or "talking absurd." I also have a habit of playing chess alone when feeling self-conscious, insecure, low self-esteem. This was my past-time during high school since it took me years to adjust from Year-around elementary school. Along with IRC roleplaying, Lego building as a special interest, hacking, reading (reading for me, in a personal setting, actually began with reading D&D Manuals; throughout high school my friends would constantly attend the local mall, where for me it possessed a storehouse of D&D Guidebooks and a Comic Book store which provided a lofty atmosphere to read the Core Rulebooks -- this means that I was able to learn how to read literature, starting from virtually only D&D Manuals, ranging from Hamlet, Plato to Spinoza, Quine, etc. within a period of ~six years -- I read through the Ethics before the age of 22, and I was actually able to demonstrate, naturally, concepts of Substance, Mode and Attribute, Human Bondage, and various of Spinoza's Proofs shortly after reading, though I read it again because I felt that I had no idea of what these words meant), installing/uninstalling Windows -- I clocked 40+ successful installations during my second "summer" of high school, building/dismantling/re-constructing various devices including but not limited to: computers, automatic torque control systems, bicycles, personal Lego concepts, most toys, chess games, recipes, Pokémon card decks, MTG card decks, yo-yos, CD, VHS players and car stereo systems, various car parts, repair and hardware tools, poems, remote control buttons, skateboards. Naturally counting became a past-time: tires, geometric figures, buttons, shoes, houses, signs, cups, nonsense jokes, tables, cracks, cigarettes, Legos [to emphasize this point: children with Asperger's are often untidy if their special interest preoccupies their time; my mother was too busy with work to prevent the 10-12, 14, 16-hour blocks of time I spent dedicated to LEGO. Ultimately I found myself to have produced hundreds of imaginary friends, each embodied in a Lego person. By a certain point, my entire room had become my "universe" where I had rebuilt all Aquazone, Spyrius, "Nascar", etc. according to my imagination (I possessed no prebuilt constructions.), along with "moonwalker" type "heros" (basically, simplistic gundam-style LEGO constructions with cockpit-human hybrid anatomies (cockpit, torso, wings, arms, legs, variously styled weapons: grappling hook, high-pressure aqua mini-gun -- think a mini-gun fire hose --, flame thrower, blasters of variety, etc.; and ballistics) who protected me during my sleep and established peace throughout the quadrants. I employed the LEGO system to produce a custom universe of my own. Each quadrant of my room was the "domain" of each, roughly, predefined "style" provided by LEGO which I highly tweak'd to my imaginative preferences. -- At the same time, my room was often a mess, to the chagrin of my mother. I constantly slept with Legos on bed and floor, and sometimes I slept on the floor. Legos draped the walls, hidden nooks of the room, shelves, the TV, underneath bed, dressers, the bed, etc., in preparation for the events of the next day. This special interest lasted for nearly 7 years before I transitioned to other special interests, the aforementioned, and more OCD-like behaviors: popping fingers, bending/poking nose, squeezing wrist, etc.], ... One of my fondest tactile memories with LEGO is the squeezing and securing of blocks together. Often I would systematically scour my room for "loose constructions" due to the wear-and-tear of play. Typically others were allowed to play with constructions, but never to dismantle or reproduce. I actually ended a very young friendship because he attempted to customize a moonwalker (I actually still possess the original "prototype" "Moonwalker" and its analogous "heros" ("Hermes", unidentified Aquazone hero -- since "space" was entirely my room, I decided that something like "UFO" applied to the "waters" of the Universe. So, space was not "mysterious", yet places like Atlantis (Aquazone) remained so; there remains an unfinished idea, that would have taken the style of something like a Transformer, which came about once I encountered the "Nascar" LEGO theme). Some days, however, I would not play with children if I did not wish for them to touch constructions. There were numerous occasions where if this mood occurred in the time of play I would become incredibly hostile and vocally hateful toward other children. It was rare, however, that I would actually take constructions from them because doing so would involving touching that person. Again, I ended a second very close friendship once my friend informed me that he found LEGO to be "boring." (He said this in passing, and what he meant was something like "at that particular time in the day." However, he would at times pester or bully me as regards what I've built. At one point, over a weekend, we actually clashed physically over a particular construction, causing it to shatter on the floor. We became more physically aggressive toward each other after this, displacing LEGO as a shared interest, replacing it with trampoline wrestling and BB Gun Duels. I shot him in the leg once before we stopped. He almost hit my right eye as I tried to confirm clearance from behind a tree, poking my head from behind a shielding tree.)

 Video Games

I am incredibly talented at Soul Caliber 2. To be candid, and not at all facetious: you cannot beat me at this game. Imagine, moreover, that the character Talim statistically takes the path of least resistance for her maneuvers. Often my "competitive" play at Soul Caliber 2 involved "lying down to defuse the momentum of battle", seemingly aimless jump-kicks and obnoxious sidestepping such that the camera of the game environment caused a kind of dizziness which I found stimulating. Most of the time, after a match, I would find myself surprised that I had won. At the arcades, I quickly became a spectacle. Others, on some occasions, when the game was popular, would ask if I had won any "competitions." Most video games I play expose a certain level of its mechanics/physics through the styles of play. Most players choose a style, I often choose to understand the mechanics of the game. So, for instance, my Street Fighter 3rd Strike (think of a 2D platform fighting game with "counters") career mostly involved Sean, a character who primarily exists within a negative space of the game's mechanics. His frame-rates are slower, less predictable, his Hadouken lags, and he rolls. He rolls. And he has a flamboyant boomerang kick. It's the best fucking Ex ever. His hurricane kick looks like he's dancing with himself, in the air. Most SF3 players, especially those at the arcade, found my tactics and strategies obnoxious. Some even groaned as I took the controller.

Systematic Downloader

Downloading music and files in general quickly became a past-time. I quickly amassed nearly 200GB of music in high school, which I deleted wholesale years later. I now sit on a store of 350+GB of music. Most of which consists of obscure math rock, discographies, newer Klezmer music and fusions, Jazz, progressive rock, emo and screamo, noise, etc.

Typetiquette

Often others note my type etiquette. I use punctuation. As mentioned before, I took on roleplaying, shortly after, displacing somewhat, the special interest in Lego. Daily I joined IRC and AOL roleplaying chats which demanded word minimums for actions, robust descriptions of character backgrounds and agency in the environment or universe of the theme (Cowboy Bebop, DBZ, modern D20, D&D). We authored short stories and short novel-length spinoffs daily, and it had to be something we'd want to read in a book. My career as a typer is largely governed by my treatment of typing as a means to produce stories or scripts. I undertook roleplaying for nearly 2 years, often spending 6 to 7 hours a day at it; this was approximately between the ages of 12-14. Naturally I took to the MUD and eventually "left the scene" once my Interest in roleplaying gave way to an interest in communication systems; i.e., the Internet, TCP/IP, "protocols", etc. Often I wondered how we could agree on the protocols of our roleplaying. Often, I introduced the "meta-gamer's problem."

A Handshake

Often other males fail to acknowledge the social custom of handshake. I do not. Usually this is the game of you. A handshake homogenizes the social order; moreover, it is a form of trust establishment. In my mind, it resembles the looking in the eye of a murderer. Skin touching restores trust at the most basic level. It took me nearly a decade before I would touch others or to allow myself to be touched. For years I would not touch the same silverware, glasses, plates, and often times simply things of other people. Over the years, I have used the handshake to over time build a proclivity for touching through the effort to shake people's hands. My handshakes are awkward because they are my coping mechanism for a deeper problem, the problem of touch in social contexts. A handshake, first, prepares me for the possibility of future touch by the agent, such that the mere touching may be immediately predicted, and thus less capable of producing anxiety.
In stage two of friendship, children develop greater cooperation when playing with their peers and develop more constructive means of dealing with conflict. It is important that the child with Asperger’s syndrome learns the theory of, and gains practice in, various aspects of cooperative play using Social StoriesTM and role-play activities. These can provide practice in aspects of cooperative play such as giving and receiving compliments, accepting suggestions, working towards a common goal, being aware of personal body space, proximity and touch, coping with and giving criticism, and recognizing signs of boredom, embarrassment and frustration and when and how to interrupt. The role-play and modelling of aspects of social interaction such as giving compliments can be recorded on video to provide practice and constructive feedback (Apple, Billingsley and Schwartz 2005). -- The Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome, Tony Attwood

Motivation, Identity Adjustment

In truth, I did not begin any personal reading of books until roughly this age. That is, I did not begin to read books until roughly 14-15, almost 16. I actually never read more than 100 pages because of high school -- I'm talking Hamlet, Homer, Dickens, Aristotle, just about everything from Victorian Literature and American Literature presented, etc., though I took Dual Credit English, etc.; them, I dismissed. (Poems were read, however. -- You might stand aback, aghast and wonder: "But all that fine authorship and culture, you philistine!" Considering the topic: Shut the fuck up. Obviously "continental authors" and more recent philosophy post-19th century were not presented. I approached my then English instructor once about this.) But which isn't much of an achievement considering that I grew up in Texas, and IPS(?) and AP test forms exist, along with more "rigorous" systems. (Often during standardized tests, like the high school AP Exam and throughout uni, I would wonder: How did this question get to this position on the exam. Considering how Web forms are presented, my attempt to answer test questions were at odds with the typographical/design algorithms which must need map to the True in order to map to Correct answers. How would you break down a Web form? -- In terms of quantity of input elements, presence of legends, answers predetermined, but if randomized over a form, those numerical qualities determine domains for which answers are in the range.) I quickly devised a method of reading which involved reading the first sentence and the last sentence of every paragraph, and ignored various topics based on subheadings. I FAILED high school chemistry used this method. I FAILED college engineering physics using a method similarly fashioned. I succeeded at Dual Credit English using this method. (An additional point, I actually submitted a Tractatus-styled paper, dealing with the logical structure of "naive realism" -- logically presented propositions conforming to a numerical syntax for premise/conclusion relation -- to my Epistemology professor during uni. I actually requested deduction for lateness to complete it. Listen, do you know what Tractatus looks like? (Conversation in the interpersonal vocal domain just seems to fail on demonstrating this point, since most people wish to talk catpiss or trollwars or real talk anyway.) I'll stop fucking talking about it and just show you, so that you get my point: I produced a 7-page paper, resembling that. Spinoza does the same thing. Ethics Demonstrated in Geometric Order was my hopeful calling to finding linguistic peers. I ultimately switched my major to philosophy because I thought this kind of authorship was common, acceptable. Roughly all of my personal writing in moleskins, journals, etc. conform to such a procedure of authorship.)

The Game of You

I believe the adoption of this "game" -- Nonsense -- says more about my social peers than about me, or not. But it should be noted: My label for this "game" is in fact my attempt at legitimizing my "word associations, fragments of the dialogue of previous conversations or seemingly quite bizarre utterances." True, it may be a game, and a fun one, where people play word-games and craft puns with one another in a kind of communal linguistic activity. Others will feel nostalgic about "Nonsense" and wonder why we don't play as often. I do not wonder these things. "Nonsense" is a name of a game I gave to one of my symptoms. As with many people who have Asperger's, I have a hypersensitivity to sonic- or aural-generating high frequency/high decibal devices. Electric cars, TVs, mobile devices, phones, AC units, large industrial machinery requiring complex inner-circuity and signaling systems, radios, microwaves, car horns, etc. Daily my life is riddled by the sonic textures of various frequencies and decibal levels. "Nonsense" is my attempt at maintaining analogical/dialectical dialogue ("It's 'like'..."-talk but over concepts, instead of events or persons -- "He's like a bitch"; "The car crash -- it was like, ridiculous"; etc.) to distract me from the barrage of sounds that I am constantly finding myself in the grips of. So I might produce or introduce jokes, analogies, metaphors, non-sequiters, "thought disorders", or monologues, such that others might play with them as well to establish a soundscape which secures thought from actual noise. Many people enjoy the game, wordsmiths and the like. They attribute it to some kind of creativity in my persona or my intellect. No. I use "nonsense" to re-orient discussion in my favor; for conversation, I introduce a baseline probability that my topic will be touched since, in essence, my topic is the dialectical bridging of topics. This is why philosophy interested me. For the most part, Wittgenstein/Positivism gave me tools for defusing a wide variety of conceptual/cognitive trajectories and tropes that are riddled throughout Western thought. I typically refer to them as "poor conceptual hygiene" (as PMS  Hacker/Michael Bennett do) or "thought ordered". The activity of blending concepts, making them vague, expand, etc. comes from my deficiencies as a conversationalist, my inability to interpret the rhythm of conversation (largely due to noise). "Nonsense" is one of my symptoms. For some reason, my friends, instead of identifying my symptom as a criteria for a social/neurological malfunction, transformed it into a game. My "resets" to conversation, my outbursts, my monologues, impromptu deadpan humour, characters, strange voices, Devil's Advocate, confusing questions ("What does that mean?" in the presence/context of an "everyday concept" as up for discussion), etc. are not taken as deficiencies, but rather virtues. This is not clear to me why. But I would imagine with shows like Twin Peaks and 30 Rock, people dropping "I loved the Pachycephalosaurus as a child" or "I'm a theological non-cognitivist" is just something people say. Hours of nonsense humor is surely something that even the learned engage in. Right. It's not creativity. It's not competition. I'm not writing a script. I'm not a wordsmith. It's an atypical neurological disposition that undermines the success of interpreting conversational cues. "Nonsense" jokes are my conversational flash bang grenades.

item.title: extends: "How to Not Kill a Cyclist"
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
"As mentioned above, drivers should never pass a cyclist if they intend to make a right-hand turn, as they will likely be cutting them off." -- How to Not Kill a Cyclist ("How to: Not Kill a Cyclist")
I believe this sentence should be re-written:
"As mentioned above, drivers should never pass a cyclist if either they or the cyclist intend to make a right-hand turn, as they will likely be cutting them off."
This may require explanation. It may not, as it seems deliciously, almost prettily vague. But I might hazard a development of the thought, as I assume, further, that it itself extends the idea: A bike is a vehicle. Passing a cycling is an idea that captures a wide number of scenarios, or rather: prompts. Should I pass this cyclist? I believe is the interrogative expression of the concept. Indeed, interrogative prompt. -- As a driver, which is quite rarer now, I cannot resist the habit of treating my driver's seat as a driver's sofa and my dashboard, wheel, et al. as well -- oh come on what do you expect me to say? A keyboard. -- It's happened, it's always been there. At any moment, truly, and you see this with web statistics survey software: window.fucking.prompt. I mean, what does "surfing the web" mean, anyway? Soon we'll be coding in our cars, but that's another story (actually, I would PREFER sometimes to have actual traffic 4-finger swiped away to my vim). What's most important is that for me: driving is effortless. All the internal engineering and ergonomics and consumerism have won. Cars are nothing more than mobile homes. We trash talk white trash: well, trashy people trash people. Only a car driver has any genuine opinion on mobile homes in general. (Sorry, I live in Texas, so this whole issue is a tad close to home.) Okay, okay. My point is this:
Every time I see an adult on a bicycle, I no longer despair for the future of the human race. — H.G. Wells
In light of all the comfort and amenities motor vehicles have to offer, some of us prefer the "interface of nature." Is "a bike is a vehicle" a decision or fact? It's both: we are all expected to know the same traffic protocols, rules, and we're all expected to understand our vehicle and that our vehicles physically limit one another while they physically affect us in our operating of them. I believe the initial quotation discloses, through its sweet vagueness, two interesting scenarios:
  1. ... drivers should never pass a cyclist if they [as a driver] intend to make a right-hand turn ...
  2. ... drivers should never pass a cyclist if they [the cyclist] intend to make a right-hand turn ...
By (1) we see the original article's point. I hardly doubt anyone needs be seriously queried, "Is it a good idea to throw a large log across the road?" Are we simple-minded androids? Perhaps. No, really -- how simple are we? Who genuinely wonders if it is all right to take up the only lane dedicated to bikes? Someone who thinks "a bicycle is a vehicle": All vehicles should obey traffic laws in similar fashion. If a bike wants to turn, it must stop, verify other vehicles, and then turn; if it wants to keep going, it must obey/acknowledge the physical space of other vehicles. This covers the "decision" aspect of the concept of the common thinker, apparently. But (2) exists. Why? "should never pass" contains a term that can be taken technically or commonly. "Technically" involves everything going on in (1): don't pass slower vehicles. But there's also attempting to pass which is embodied in the question: Should I pass? -- As one is driving, upon entering that interrogative mode of thought, one thing is noticed: passing involves acceleration. The point here? What if the cyclist intends to make a right-hand turn and you happen to be behind her. Should you pass? Should you attempt to pass? Should you accelerate at all? I believe obviously the answer is again "no". A bicycle is a vehicle after all. What's going on when a cyclist makes a right-hand turn? Well, they're operating a vehicle, for one. Consider this: What does a stick shift driver have to pull off to make a right-hand turn? Exactly. And that's a "vehicle" too. Have you ever considered what a cyclist must pull off in order to safely, comfortably make a right-hand turn, considering the assumption of other vehicles on the road? Typically we think: it's all-right to pass slower vehicles. Naturally, in this case, a cyclist is operating a slower vehicle. Yet, for some reason, people tend to accelerate to speeds as if they were passing a slower vehicle. My question: Why does the circumstance of [a cyclist] making a right-hand turn somehow make it permissible to do the exact opposite of the rule of thumb of (1). Don't technically pass if, as a driver, you intend to make a right-hand turn; yet driving at speeds resembling technically passing a cyclist is permissible so long as the cyclist is making a right-hand turn. How about this. If you're a driver, always check for right-hand turns, either in yourself or from others, including cyclists. If you see a cyclist, do not pass. If you see a cyclist making a right-hand turn, do not pass, and do not speed up.
