item.title: Scotty's Spacestone?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Give up your terrestrial religion. "Dust to dust." We are stardust. "Make your astrofootprint (astral footprint)!" Etc.,etc., ... I think such a gesture is a great move to motivate others to recast their religious mode of thought toward a finer jewel than "God": rather, "Space." No pretense is necessary: your ashes do not return to God, or Heaven, to the Earth, God's Creation, or any of that: your ashes become stardust, incompatible with the homeostatic metaphysic of Scripture, of Earth, as a pool of sin. For instance, with this thought, immediately one must give up the doctrine of method, found in Scripture. By "method" I suggest the interpretation: applied method, exampled by use of the Scripture as a guide to scientific knowledge. Moreover, the Scripture, in choosing the twilight graveyard, holds no claim to ethical method. Its text, its God, cannot predict the immeasurable qualities of elemental complexity, the universe itself, the conduit of life.

item.title: Foot Grammar
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I believe programmers et al. should attempt to play more futball. Just play through the pain of it. You will quickly develop a grammar (like in vim!) which helps with establishing Flow.
Do not work out for your "health" or by dietary theories (which are largely based on Western dietary habits anyway). Work out to understand how Flow can be expressed beyond typing at a keyboard. (Consider that in most contexts where we talk about "Flow," studies involve sedentary activities: playing video games, typing/programming, flying a simulator or an actual air-vehicle, driving, etc.) What is with the given assumption that Flow involves Hands/Brain? Why not Feet/Brain? Imagine being able to establish Flow immediately while engaged in a physically exhausting activity. How far will you go? For how long will you play?
In short time, your body will naturally develop into the kind of fitness appropriate to the limits of your mental limitations. Moreover, you may develop a grammar for your feet which is analogous to the grammar of your hands (in the context of a keyboard -- consider that we all type relatively uniquely to ourselves, a typolect, if you will, despite "Standardized" keyboard formats; in the context of vim -- verbs, nouns, modifiers, sentences, paragraphs, etc.): Foot Grammar (might allow for "propositions" of the foot which demand a fitness level (performance criterion) to express them.
You type through the pain of the monitor against your eyes. You type and think through fluorescent lighting. Carpal Tunnel. Etc. This is why we suggest getting up and stretching, walking about, to combat these minor physical impairments which involve attrition over time. So many physical analogues exist which naturally make playing futball a sensible, and moreover social (!), activity for programmars.
I type through wrist pain and learn a new framework. I kick through foot pain and learn a new tactile passing system.

item.title: The End of Class-based Psychology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Candidly? Shut the fuck up with the blind assent to authoritarian psych schools (again). Stop taking pills. Stop making up placebo psychological predicates. Stop talking about yourself, and start studying yourself. Self-diagnose -- You know how to fucking read. Class-based Psychology, the product of Industrial-Capitalism, from Jung to Cognitive schools to the Descriptivist-Narrative Schools, is over. From positivism to current political theory, they instill in the media principles to obscure our abilities to understand the world, but as yet they assume that we have these abilities, but misguided. Indeed, stop feeding us the media. Their assumption? That we are all "little scientists," as Putnam would have it, who ultimately yield to the authority of practice in scientific praxis itself. Well, fuck that. And fuck you. Be the theorist you want to see in the world.

item.title: js://js.js/js.js?js=js.js
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This thought isn't fleshed out, but it is essentially my initial reaction to the following. So, why not serve JS on a different protocol? "http" is misleading for these resources. CSS as well. Consider css://domain.com/ returns a style guide-like page for GET. Sure, JS and CSS documents have "hypertext," so it technically is not misleading to continue serving them as such. However, one motivation behind this idea is that hypermedia and hypertext are both served through HTTP/S. But, moreover, hyperresources, let's say, are also served through HTTP/S. For hypertext documents, we expect for there to be a reader who might follow links. In serving JS and CSS over HTTP, are we not assuming that bots, crawlers, etc. are following links in the same way that a human reader might? Human readers read hypertext. In some cases, we read and follow the links within CSS documents. But ultimately, after optimization and normalization of presentation layer documents, they are rendered intentionally non-readable. Who then is supposed to follow their hypertext except for a narrowly defined reader?

item.title: I think I have become left-handed
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
#I think I have become left-handed
What if writing only involved typing? What if all the experiences of your day, Were an attempt to train your ear? An attempt to structure your brain?

item.title: Slow Reading & Asperger's Syndrome
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In Nietzsche's "Daybreak":
It is not for nothing that one has been a philologist, perhaps one is a philologist still, that is to say, a teacher of slow reading. — Friedrich Nietzsche
Besides, we are friends of the lento, I and my book. I have not been a philologist in vain — perhaps I am one yet: a teacher of slow reading. I even come to write slowly. At present it is not only my habit, but even my taste — a perverted taste, maybe — to write nothing but what will drive to despair every one who is ‘in a hurry.’ For philology is that venerable art which exacts from its followers one thing above all — to step to one side, to leave themselves spare moments, to grow silent, to become slow — the leisurely art of the goldsmith applied to language: an art which must carry out slow, fine work, and attains nothing if not lento. Thus philology is now more desirable than ever before; thus it is the highest attraction and incitement in an age of ‘work’: that is, of haste, of unseemly and immoderate hurry-skurry, which is so eager to ‘get things done’ at once, even every book, whether old or new. Philology itself, perhaps, will not so hurriedly ‘get things done.’ It teaches how to read well, that is, slowly, profoundly, attentively, prudently, with inner thoughts, with the mental doors ajar, with delicate fingers and eyes. My patient friends, this book appeals only to perfect readers and philologists: learn to read me well! — Friedrich Nietzsche
Instead of "speed reading" I believe Aspie's should intentionally focus the structure of their powers of Special Interest towards books. Consider Tony Attwood's observations in The Complete Guide to Asperger's Syndrome:
Activities to encourage flexible thinking and the ability to engage in pretend play can include games where the objective is to invent as many uses as possible for a given object – that is, to think beyond the most obvious, functional use of that object. For example, how many uses can be thought of for a brick, a paper clip, a section of toy train track, and so on? The section of train track could become the wings of an aeroplane, a sword or a ladder, for example. This will encourage the ability to ‘break set’ when problem solving and be more comfortable when involved in pretend play with other children.
I, for instance, create mnemonic devices from the First Letter of sentences of significant paragraphs of books. Then I produce a grid that I use as a "conceptual barometer." From a book I'm reading: 
S C I C I
T B I A I A
A T I N T H
T I A T A
Which can be used to memorize as well. If Aspies with decent memory use this, it may help with retention.

item.title: Type-marshaling Dilemma & the Hypermedia Solution
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The question architects and designs of distributed network applications need to ask is not, "How can a server successfully export its private objects in a way that clients can see and use them?" Instead the question that should be asked is, "How can a server and client share a common understanding of the payloads passed between them?"

A list of popular responses to the type-marshaling dilemma

  1. Shared schema
  2. URI construction
  3. Payload decoration
  4. Narrow media types

The Hypermedia Solution

Relying on payloads based on hypermedia designs avoids the common pitfalls of the type-marshaling dilemma. That's because hypermedia payloads carry more information than just the data stored on the server. Hypermedia payloads carry two types of vital metadata: metadata about the data itself and metadata about the possible options for modifying the state of the application at the moment. Both are important to enabling stable and flexible distributed network applications. — Mike Amundsen, Building Hypermedia APIs with HTML5 & Node [my emphasis]

item.title: The Guilt of Stimming
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The other day I enjoyed the park, with a small gang. One of them, a vibrant and reliable member of my local community, has a clinical diagnosis somewhere on the Autism Spectrum (AS). He's older, nearly to his 50s, and in terms of his personality, it is quite apparent his Asperger's. But what is more, what many others may not notice, is that the knuckles on his hands are slightly mutilated. In my mind, upon noticing this, I was immediately compelled to all of those times I've slammed my fists into walls, trees, doors, the ground, the cement, cars, fences, pipes, park benches, brick houses, windows, and so on. Most interesting of all is that Aspies are the one's who, presumably, maintain a great attention to detail, but yet, they are less inclined or less enabled, socially, to assert or express those details. Moreover, others will lack that attention to detail. It seems almost a vicious cycle. In any event, his knuckles look the worst. But he has no trouble convincing others of his Asperger's. He has fully grown into it, I s'pose. I, of course, on the other hand, have had a difficult time convincing others of my condition. Perhaps my own is mild, or not. Or perhaps I have been successful at merging myself into the social sphere. Or, simply, others lack attention to detail. Often others find me "mysterious" because of my cold demeanor, lack of facial expression or "stealthy" because of my peculiar walking habits (I still "toe walk" -- which is a clinical symptom of Asperger's). Attwood shares some criteria: 1 Diagnosis of autism in infancy or early childhood 2 Recognition of Asperger's syndrome in early school years 3 The previous diagnosis of another developmental disorder 4 First recognition of the clinical signs in adolescence 5 The suggestion of a conduct or personality disorder 6 Diagnosis of a relative with autism or Asperger's syndrome 7 Recognition of the signs of Asperger's syndrome from the media 8 Employment problems   As I grow older, I most readily identify with 8. Even my last employer at Waste Management, one of the VPs, made note of the fact that I, at 25, had never held a job longer than a year. I thought my response to that question would break any chance I had at winning the position. -- Most people in daily social life consider Asperger's as a plea for pity or, paradoxically enough, a vying for attention; an expression of one's uniqueness. All the same, Asperger'sisa disorder in many regards, a perpetual developmental disorder that, at some points, affects one person and that person alone: the patient. However, as a child, 2, 4, and 5 made the most sense. I may entertain 2 and 5 later in life, but at the moment 4 is critical. I, to put it briefly, have dealt with stimming my entire life, sometimes to my dismay. In its most extreme expression, stimming may involve outright self-harm or self-injury. And naturally such behavior frightens neurotypicals. Weeks back I decided to undertake a bike ride with friends, after the bar, to grab Mexican food. During our ride, I, as per usual, decided to play aggressive. The conclusion was a very precise skid stop into a right-side shoulder dive to the road. Most of the others, once we made it to the restaurant, were simply confused, perhaps even distraught. What they fail to understand is that this activity, this expression of my autistic system, has been a ritual in my life. When I started my career at futball, I gave it an appellation: falling drills. My reasoning is that falling is a limit of the human form; at the same time, rational (or rather reliable) action is possible within the context of a fall; a fall is a limit to, not a preclusion of, action. In terms of jeet kune do, a martial arts system I thoroughly enjoy, it means, for me, to express the natural personality traits of water: a fall is an opportunity to conform. Typically my falling drills in futball involve diving or staggering or dropping while still maintaining the well-defined objective: manipulate the ball, either to pass, defer, or shoot the ball. But I digress. In younger life, my stimming expressed itself as wall-punches, head butts, slamming my face to the desk, breaking broomsticks and various other types of wooden objects over my thighs, or, simply, punching myself in the jaw. I once "knocked" myself out. I realized the joy, or pleasure, inducible by such pain when, as a youngster, I walked into an unlit restroom only to be rudely interrupted by a wall hand-dryer that put me to the floor in a hurry, seeing stars and nearly a concussion. Taking my fist to my jaw was always mild by comparison, but no less pleasurable. -- What I notice today, however, is that others have begun to question, in a wider sense, my tendency to self-stimulate. For decades I've cracked my knuckles, to the point where my right hand has noticeable damage, and is permanently swollen. Let us be clear: this is a clinical sign of Asperger's syndrome. I made a short career, when younger, of finger-flipping, but most prominent was my wrist writhing, or wrist wringing. In later years I moved to squeezing my nose. There are noticeable bruises on my nose. A manager at Waste Manage once, actually, made a joke about it involving "brown-nosing." What am I to do when no one will accept my self-diagnosis, and as yet I must endure not only my own symptoms, but the consequences they engender in crude, mean, ugly, nasty humans? What am I to do when, being of a certain level of attractiveness, I must live in a bubble of my own undoing? I keep all the negative comments of the world, which are wholly unfair and hateful. As an Aspie, my memory is nearly supreme, immaculate. Is this a good thing? Am I boasting? Might I have a penchant for facts, science? All the same, I remember when you didn't shake my hand, dissing me. Or when you drafted a nickname for me which was nothing more than an expression of a neurodevelopmental disorder I have very little control over. Rather, stimming is voluntary, under certain activities; but that one should need to self-stimulate at all is not. I can choose when I wish squeeze my nose, or fold my arms, or crack my knuckles, but that I should engage in such activities is part of my psychological profile. What's more? I have managed to discover tools for systematic stimming. And this speaks to the "wider sense" in which my stimming has become apparent, regardless of the obliviousness of friends and family. These tools involve a rubber tube ring that I stumbled over, months ago, and hair bands. Often people wonder why I wear these things, as if they were some kind of cultural baggage, as if they were expressions of a non-American past. Indeed, this is absolutely not the case. The hair bands restrict blood flow into my hands, numbing them, but also causing mild discomfort over my wrists. Wrist-writhing nullified.The tube ring has drastically reduced the number of times a day that I crack the knuckle on my right hand, as it is an obstruction which prevents. Knuckle-cracking nullified. However, what do we make of his mutilated knuckles? What might I be warranted in claiming about him on that bit of evidence alone? -- Months back a lady friend once queried me, "Do you ever get violent?" But well after, I thought, she and I had established a relationship so robust that the answer should be obvious to her, at least in that sense of "violent." Moreover, she asked this based on the hearsay of some other guy who was clearly, and she understood this, trying to get into her pants. But, moreover, Aspies have a tendency to self-harm. So he took one of my symptoms and spun it against me. Do I get violent? Surely. But I also have a history of slamming my head on desks, punching trees, etc., etc., etc. This is why it is important for people to understand. Because it is easy for people to use my own symptoms against me. I speculate that it becomes a necessary requirement for social maturity that those with Asperger's not only must learn the customs of their peers, but they must also learn to overcome the guilt which follows from others' perception of their clinical signs. Generally speaking, Aspies must not only grow as social agents, despite their forms of "muteness," but moreover they must also learn how to manage how people treat their symptoms. That is, Aspies must develop a system for minimizing psychologically contracted abuse due to their symptoms. Aspies must learn to manage self-directed and other-directed abuse. (Once another lady friend described me as a "table" and more or less commenced treat me as if an inanimate object, wrapping and flailing her legs at and around mine wildly, trying to break the fixed nature of my bodily arrangement. I tend to lack any care for how others treat my body, assuming that I "trust" them, which can be hard-earned for those befriending Aspies. Of course, no one enjoys being "objectified.")

item.title: I believe in "Discovery": We are Aasimar
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
What if Asperger’s Syndrome was defined by its strengths? What changes might occur? -- The Discovery of “Aspie” Criteria
Look, I'm going to be frank with you. We have, in our generation, Aubrey de Grey talking candidly of Robust Human Rejuvenation, Juan Enriquez speculating that we are witnessing first-hand the evolution of our species: homo evolutis (extreme dietary systems, too-much-information, gene reinforcement, (research) chemicals). Transhumanism is now a viable philosophy. And with the DSM-5, regardless of the bankruptcy of "evidence" in American psychology, we will see a more thorough-going analysis of "Asperger's Syndrome" in terms of a "severity-based" system within the concept of Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD). I think that we, as aspies, have a decision to make. Our decision, ultimately, may determine the trajectories of "posthuman discovery." (Moreover, I have a slew of other questions to throw at the topic, chief of them being: How do you, NT, expect me to obey your industrial-capitalist legal system when, for all intents and purposes, such a legal system cannot even viably assess the nature of my intent, someone who is nearly inscrutable, cognitively, to that system. I was put in jail months back, and I cannot understand why. My legal system attempted to "correct" me, but all it did was induce depression and ruin my career as a Web Developer, and a very highly sought after Web Developer in Texas. Or the other point: I will never play futball for the United States. Why should I obey these laws when they do nothing for me except harm? For all intents and purposes, I believe there is a set group of aspies who are "above law.")
If the proposed intervention would result in an enhancement, why have we not already evolved to be that way? -- "Algernon's Law"
Most obviously the main issue here is choice. For aasimar "being outcasts among their peers during their formative years and being given a significant amount of strange attention from the superstitious" results in, ultimately, the lack of choice in the matter, indeed. When {naturally} one is primed, either through social muteness (being able to focus on details rather than human interaction, be those details linguistic or scientific or what have you) or through one's ability to harness stimming in such a way as to outperform neurotypicals in sporting activities, for enhancement, how at all should it be perceived as a difficult choice for an Aspie? The natural abilities for Aspies offsets them socially and cognitively. -- When I play futball, my finger-flip in order to "release" (or rather regulate) the quantity of stress produced over time which is induced directly from my playing futball, which enables focus, precision, and quite simply, excellence.

To the point:

"Aasimar are also quite preceptive, noticing things that others do not..." is stated in the Forgotten Realms supplementary guide. More -- "Even those raised by understanding parents cannot escape their strangeness, or the curiosity [(or even fear) that their unique nature sometimes results in. Many aasimar are even prejudiced against, something that deeply hurts the soul of the aasimar in question since most have an inherent bend towards empathy for others." -- Obviously. More -- "Nearly all aasimar are uncommonly beautiful and still, and they are often significantly taller than humans as well." --
Hans Asperger, who published a pioneering account of autism in 1944, remarked on the ethereal beauty of his patients almost as if it were a diagnostic symptom. -- Beautiful Children
I am happy with Attwood and Gray's notion of discovery. But in this era, in our time, what we are discovering are the existence of aasimar. I'm not joking with you. Imagine the intersection of ASDs and the 577R gene, what do we discover when we find aspies who not only expression clinical signs but possess the 577R gene?

item.title: Not only should you delete your Facebook, but ...
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
You should set your /etc/hosts or c:/windows/system32/drivers/etc/hosts to point facebook.com to localhost. If someone asks, say "Well, I'd have to reconfigure a few things first". Try it.
This week, DNSChanger may affect a significant number of people. Why? Facebooking is the motivation to share, but often as one would share content on all systems, even e-mail, now in browsers.
Fuck chain letters. Fuck deepest desire.

item.title: Response to Facebook Job Postings Board Concept
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Let's assume Facebook will cover Microsoft's old turf. That said, I wouldn't want to work through FB/MS anyway (think MS Certs, 'corporate dev bloat' with SharePoint... Now... FB Job Auth API). And I might be able to leverage my 'brand aversion' to isolate dev shops I do wish to work under. They probably would prefer it that I not allow the 'excess' of FB into my life anyway. Or they might simply find FB's brand generally repugnant. All in all, FB won't be leading tech-intersect-science innovation (designer drugs through cool UIs, all the NP-hard problems that come from dual hypertext/image cool URIs, neural networks and actual utilities and ecological solutions). FB, at best, will be the ID/human-auth system for SpaceX. FB has inherently limited itself to custodian software. Keeping the 'human namespace' tidy. Boring. Like MS and its 'hardware philanthropy' FB just wants to be present with the path of least resistence (PHP anybody?). MS succeeded with its imperative to put hardware everywhere, and they naturally earn market victory with that. Well, now humans are the new hardware, and FB is approaching that model. 'Desperation' should be determined based on how closely FB mirrors MS's Moore's Law Model. That would presuppose artificial shaping of the market (something along the lines of eugenics-thinking). There will still be innovation, and that's what we will compete for.

item.title: Date Thyself
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I date myself constantly. Films, sleeping in with the Sun, long walks, al fresco dining, music shows, bike riding alone until 4AM, coffeeshopping until all the "regulars" leave, longboarding, monitoring music for hours, futball, going to the park, reading in public, people watching, playing with animals (I'm actually DJ Kitty Tummy Rub.), etc. Bear in mind these are all date material -- my ideal partner(/partners?) would enjoy grabbing nothing but a book and finding just about anywhere or anyway to read. Just about every morning begins with vocal stimming, and it's usually easier if someone else is available to provide an extra sound cue. I once chased down two cyclists I thought would be ready to ride through the night, but she reached out her hand to embrace him, thus compelling me to realize that I had been doing this for years. I just get in the way of NTs who engage in activities for primarily social reasons. Another time, after confessing interest in a friend, she, taken aback, informed me that she had to learn how to be alone. This was revealing to me, as it was something I could not at all understand. And I knew I couldn't understand it. I've had pretty severe training in learning to be alone, since grade school, throughout the "awkward years," and now, at times. Often, even in conversation, I feel alone as most others will dismiss my sharing of information about, say, the cure for cavities or SpaceX's real and actual progress. It's been happening for years, that I must endure conversations about bodily functions, sexual escapades, or how much work sucks. -- If I ever get trapped on a des(s)ert island, I should hope that at most I have my wits about me. It's not that I'm lonely but that by a certain time of the day, I'm bored with myself. Which is fair, usually by 3PM, I've read 5 scientific articles or concocted 5 web app ideas. I certainly have nothing to learn from people who are learning how to be alone. If anything, I'm a seasoned veteran at that -- should I call this insomnia, or simply my second wind? My only problem is that other social agents is a special interest of mine; so, for instance, I absolutely enjoy finding other Aspies, or learning the approaches NTs et al take during talk exchanges. I suppose you could call it that: I have a special interest in talk exchanges. So, for instance, I once ran 5 miles with two NTs and gave a thorough exposition of Alain Badiou's mathematical ontology.

item.title: Quantum Physics in Neuroscience
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The theoretically important point is that classical physics, and the associated doctrine of materialism, fail to coherently explain self-directed neuroplastic phenomena, while the quantum mechanical principles that causally integrate mentalistic and physicalistic data clearly and explicitly do. Because experientially based language is not logically reducible to classical materialist terminology, yet such mentalistic language is a logical prerequisite for the design, execution, and description of volitionally directed neuroplastic phenomena, the attempt to explain such phenomena in solely materialist terms must be abandoned as a matter of principle: the logical structure of materialism is inadequate in these cases. In the light of the causal structure of quantum physics, as described in some detail in later sections of this article, the case for giving brain mechanisms a privileged position as the sole cause of our conscious efforts, and of their consequences, has become radically atheoretical and ungrounded in reason. Quantum Physics in Neuroscience, Schwartz, Stapp, and Beauregard

item.title: Ben Godfrey, Adam Bricks, Ancient Cat Society
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This show reminded me how sweet, warming, rock music can be, as deviant musicians not only play their instruments, but dearly extend sound, noise itself, with their innermost notions. These artists make Houston absolutely essential. A madhouse of enchanting instrumentation from wholly charming cowpeople. They are crafting a sound, of folk to gypsy to saloon from dusty ballads, idle mental shaves, into simply noise primitivism. Are they playing music, or simply playing? I doubt it matters to these childlike yet seasoned musicians. Throughout I felt as if I had been removed from the world, taken from my hometown, from the ordinary, and placed elsewhere. Somewhere near or far, or whenever, but certainly not home, not something conventional; yet though astonishingly I at the same moments found myself reminded, by their play, of all the things which make home being worth getting sick over. A strange feeling, which I doubt I can truly relate, if only to say that these musicians have reminded me of the beauty of live music, of musicians developing together. Thinking: Cat Power, Bedhead, Retsin, Commander Venus, John Fahey, Jack Rose, etc.

item.title: A mouse is a rodent; the name of my last cleaner
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I suppose it has come to this. Shirley? -- A previous draft precedes. Where are we? In time, strato-politically speaking? What might describe an astronomical economy? To which other species, perhaps more intelligent than us, nevertheless are logically capable of adapting to a phenomenon, one such that it might be described by an economic force itself adaptable to the cosmic rigors of explored space. A suspicion is this: such that features of human being need must adapt to the real force of machines. Most notably that force represents itself as an economic substrate to the natural constitution of beings unified in a fabric (@see blankets, DK) of ecologically present contexts. A grammar for machines is necessary, such that humans need not discover marginal concern for their well being. I say "need not" in a manner where the logical possibility of the incompatibility of their well being follows from any premise linked to the presentation of the well being of machines -- So what I'm saying is that some philosophers are selected for writing sacred texts. Why? When? Which texts? Who gives a fuck? Well -- It's sort of like: What's the last sentence?; Who knows? When do they know? What shapes the stuff of an internet ecology? So I've taken a cup of water at a coffeeshoppe. Everybody seems to be okay with this. Whence cometh the incompatibility of freeganism? The determination of devaluation, an antagonism, of biodiversity? (( The Categories of a Hyperlexic. )) What can we do to them, yet what cannot be done us? -- Like with CI, what is exposed is the presentation of the other. Its capabilities run the gamut against a multiplicity of structure. Gradually one must adapt to the extended abilities of machines. Let us introduce a new feat: Stealth Computing -- Consider one premiss: A person uses a mobile device, and shares it. Any person thus can be triangulated simply by least resistant patterns describing geopolitical metadata. We touch these devices, and obviously there is a log of it. Who isn't using the device? Why would they use it? Under what conditions? IP addresses conceal only in virtue of being differentiated, not for that they are non-organic. Mapping humans to IP addresses is clearly a consideration. I might call this a thoughthack. Thoughthacking. Do it. There may come a time when reliable computer use determines, as opposed to economic placement, the registered knowledge of the individual. Where one goes on the web -- How one accessed it -- A network of keys.

item.title: Calling a Space
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Asperger's is calling a space. It's, like, a tyranny over metaphysical real estate, y'know?
To be frank, however, just _why_ are they so wierd? Awkward? What is this _evolutionarily novel advantage_? Mightn't it be that to secure personal security, woven into the fabric identity, aasimar from within express, in their constitution, a principle, perhaps a gene, of, in Heideggerian parlance, _withdrawal_?
Stimming exposes a tension. We are as tension opposed to tension. (( The Presentation of Boredom -- How well, or, to put it ever so prettily, richly might a species _express_ boredom? ))
_If one needs people, one is weak_. And how many times we have heard this before. Its transpositive being that strength entails solitude. A consolidation of pleasure principles wanes in the vertigo of human expectation.

item.title: Last time: Discovery Criteria of Aspie
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Taken from The Discovery of "Aspie" Criteria. A. A qualitative advantage in social interaction, as manifested by a majority of the following: 1. peer relationships characterized by absolute loyalty and impeccable dependability 2. free of sexist, “age-ist”, or culturalist biases; ability to regard others at “face value” 3. speaking one’s mind irrespective of social context or adherence to personal beliefs 4. ability to pursue personal theory or perspective despite conflicting evidence 5. seeking an audience or friends capable of: enthusiasm for unique interests and topics; 6. consideration of details; spending time discussing a topic that may not be of primary interest 7. listening without continual judgement or assumption 8. interested primarily in significant contributions to conversation; preferring to avoid ‘ritualistic small talk’ or socially trivial statements and superficial conversation. 9. seeking sincere, positive, genuine friends with an unassuming sense of humour B. Fluent in “Aspergerese”, a social language characterized by at least three of the following: 1. a determination to seek the truth 2. conversation free of hidden meaning or agenda 3. advanced vocabulary and interest in words 4. fascination with word-based humour, such as puns 5. advanced use of pictorial metaphor C. Cognitive skills characterized by at least four of the following: 1. strong preference for detail over gestalt 2. original, often unique perspective in problem solving 3. exceptional memory and/or recall of details often forgotten or disregarded by others, for example: names, dates, schedules, routines 4. avid perseverance in gathering and cataloguing information on a topic of interest 5. persistence of thought 6. encyclopaedic or ‘CD ROM’ knowledge of one or more topics 7. knowledge of routines and a focused desire to maintain order and accuracy 8. clarity of values/decision making unaltered by political or financial factors D. Additional possible features: 1. acute sensitivity to specific sensory experiences and stimuli, for example: hearing, touch, vision, and/or smell 2. strength in individual sports and games, particularly those involving endurance or visual accuracy, including rowing, swimming, bowling, chess 3. “social unsung hero” with trusting optimism: frequent victim of social weaknesses of others, while steadfast in the belief of the possibility of genuine friendship 4. increased probability over general population of attending university after high school 5. often take care of others outside the range of typical development

item.title: Become a Web Developer, perchance a list of essentials
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Information Architecture
  • Developing Modular or Social Code (OOP techniques for a wide range of tech stacks/languages, SCM; git, SASS, LESS, e-mail inliner tools, etc.)
  • Execution of a Design [markup thinking (HTML, etc.), presentation organisation, or organization of code (CSS), commenting, responsive layout development]
  • Frameworks, APIs, Systems [Rails, Django, Meteor, Heroku, DCPU-16, etc.]
  • Optimization and Browsers [Mobile First (@media queries), JS, JIT, SPDY, HTTP, TCP/IP, etc.]
  • Documentation and Authorship of... [take a logic class]
  • Research [finding the right tools, knowing which tools are relevant]
  • Interaction and Games [I mean really, we're already talking about hooking up links to events in games like WOW. So, yes, even a designer needs to understand why he or she is providing error message alternatives in mock-up.]
  • Working with Humans [Humans often are not within cognitive or linguistic capacity to express sincerely what they want when it comes to complex interactions between data or programmatic objects. It takes serious effort to develop actionable content from phone calls or meetings, which can be incredibly impromptu. Social setting, dispositional factors, intentful listening, dialectics, etc. should be considered.]

item.title: Agents and ad hoc geoeconomic triangulation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Agents frequently take ad hoc digital photos, nearly immediately uploading them to the Internet. A social context may be developed, strictly speaking, from the count of those people statistically probable to occur at a geoeconomic point. Agents include within an ad hoc digital photo can be recognized and determine to move along predictable geoeconomic trajectories or paths, given time of day, time of week, special events, cultural sites, externally presented interests (web profiles, etc.). Any social circle may delimit maximally a geoeconomic environment, or community, strictly speaking, or planned economy. Using computer vision libraries, object and face determine may be used to develop possible ad hoc geoeconomic networks for which agents are weighted nodes. Consider human agents as nodes in a tag cloud; under any geoeconomic environment, an average of interest and economic potential from agents can be used to determine the momentum of economic force, from an agent at any given time. Each node may contextualize a sequence of terms, say in a tag cloud, given the substantive content for which the tags are members of the cloud. So, it seems that agents may similarly determine a range of economic force within a context. That force may be used to determine where and when those agents may transition from one context to another. Recording points of interaction between agent and context, or environment, involves the distribution of categorically similarly economic trajectories. Moreover, agents captured, unwittingly, in ad hoc records, or photos, imply an economic force of their peers, and so to, all together, an arrangement of their geoeconomic position, and thus approximated geographic positioning.

item.title: Embodied Quantum Mind
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
A material description is supported by the Standard Model, and largely Newtonian Physics. It describes the behavior of macroscopic bodies as subject to laws like Gravity and properties like gestalt mass. A physical description describes behavior and properties on which material behaviors and properties supervene; should physical descriptions invalidate or not support a material description, the question remains whether the physical description is more reliable than the material description. Self-directed neuroplasticity, a phenomenon discovered in cognitive-behavior therapy results, suggests that under certain experimental settings, experiential data is best explained (abductive reasoning) by physical description and theorizing. Physical descriptions, as evidenced by the prediction and successful isolation of the Higgs Boson, are compatible with quantum mechanical explanations, which supports a finer set of laws and observations and heuristics about the possible behavior of all bodies in the universe. Many of my philosophical peers find it shocking that I should suggest that quantum mechanics has made its way into neuroscience. I find this incredibly laughable, that, namely, that I should be talking out of my ass. How many persons, old guards of experimental thought from prior generations, found themselves undermined because statistically their peers were not caught up, and thus they, themselves, become treated as if mad. -- What happened to truth being stranger than fiction? What happened to sincere dialectics? As a Spinozist, I have long awaited for neuroscience to discover the reliability and veracity of the "field" as applied to the mind, where the blush of the face, similarly, does not describe a relation between the blush and some face, but rather a quality of the face. All the same, a particular object in space-time expresses a quality of its environment. Evolution clearly suggests this -- "If, during the long course of ages and under varying conditions of life, organic beings vary at all in the several parts of their organization [...]" (Darin's Danger Algorithm). So a quark or neuron, or what have you, may express a qualitylike behavior within its arrangements within a feature of certain reality. So, we might say that a jumping over a fence is a quality of the mode which sensibly describes all those reasons for which the jumping took place. Indeed, the jumping may not have happened, but it did, and probably would again.
From a scientific perspective the key issue here is determinism. Not all but almost all scientists believe that our minds are determined by physical changes in our brains and that if you knew enough, which they don't believe they do and few believe they will ever know enough, but if you knew enough you could tell what the brain state will be at time T1 by knowing what the brain state was at time T0 and what else happened in between. And from knowing that brain state, if you knew enough, you'd be able to deduce the mental state. And that all of our thoughts and actions in that sense are determined by the physical state of our brain which is determined by physical issues in the universe. That I think almost all neuroscientists believe. Hank Greely, Law, Stanford

item.title: A poem from an anarchist
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
I have lost all embrace for the economic categories,
  and the social relations of industrial capitalism --
  I cannot entertain the "power" of a revenue fulcrum,
  a person whose perceptions are curtailed, limited by
  the valuation of consumerist ethics, an ecologically
  blind system of ad hoc supplanted moral proscription.

item.title: Structures of Silence Immanent in Intentional Spaces
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: For Spinoza, a redness of the face is a certain and determinate way a face can be. A face may become red for many reasons; however, blushing on the face indicates a certain and determinate way that the face is red. Like an analogy, instantiated blushingness excludes a range of certain and determinate ways for the face to be red. In similar fashion, a cat being in a room, or on a mat, indicates a certain and determinate way for the cat in its natural properties to be in arrangement within a mode. Certainly, the cat could not be on the ceiling. But its being on the mat excludes this, and more, it does inform us of the physical limitations, and thus viable physical conditions. Blushing indicates redness has opportunity. Being on the mat indicates particles have opportunity. A colleague (M.W.) coined the notion semantic silence. I might call it a semantic gap. It seems amenable to semantic inertial fields, or something such; namely in that the natural lack of attention toward a concept or topic suggests a normative silence over that topic. Consciously, one may choose that torture should be undiscussable (R. Gaita). Moreover, a social system may lack any discussion, as a matter of natural fact, of their ultimate astro-political effects on nearby solar systems. -- Indeed, what are the ultimate astrological effects of a planet under ecological crisis? A more palpable example may be the ignorance surrounding Fair Trade co-ops both theirs, of the stock markets in NY and London, and consumers, of those commodity producers' matters of real concern (education, utilities development, of planned economies, etc.). The silence resembles the force of an audience to a death row inmate: silence engineers, or may engender, that to which attention should be directed. On the other hand, from mechanical, or natural, silence can one infer what is not a matter of real concern? Silence tells us what is not in thought, under some conditions. Under others, it directs, or functions as executive, to an intentional space. Might silence inform us of the semantic potential of an intentional space, over an agent or group of agents?

item.title: Leptographical Vector Economics (Acid Test #5)

item.title: Why Facebook Sucks
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Even those of you who use it to manage your Friendships, or your Business Contacts (

Ask yourself this: 13 year olds use Facebook to manage their social lives. Are you seriously arguing that as a marketer or business strategist, Facebook is your primary tool, the same tool that pre-teens and cam-whores use? Really?

). -- Mostly because Silicon Valley says step away from the device? And is Facebook's ad model a scam? And its bogus advertising model that leaves our closest friends babbling about their sex lives rather than their creative endeavors. That Facebook compels, makes compulsory (Did you see my post about how much I hate X?), negative consumption: the consumption of Friends' consumption, rather than the consumption of Friend's production. For instance: Status Update: "X made me feel bad." Comments: "First!", "[meme response]", "like", etc. All of that happens, of course, and ads are still soaring throughout all of that. Facebook is basing its model on the idea of someone interjecting "sound ads" throughout your socializing and conversing with people; it's advertising Tourette's. It's the empty feeling of not being able under follow a conversation at a bar because the music is too loud, or the football game, that feeling where it seems like the person with whom you are conversing continues to talk as if you are listening. You know that you are not listening, yet somehow this person is treating you as if you are. It engenders that high school cafeteria busybody feeling, all day long. -- It is stealing my friends, and is making most people I know more irritable, anxious, and bored. Isn't it just a dating site, anyway? Deep down? And it's built on PHP.

item.title: Hypoconatalism
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The computer is being used in so many ways to extend our abilities, I can see no other possibility than to regard it as part of our extended phenotype. [...] The reason that humans have succeeded so well in comparison with many other life forms is the development of language, and therefore of memes that make us much more flexible in our ability to survive. Particularly successful memes have caused paradigm shifts in human society, fueling the next generation of memes. Evidence shows that the rate of change of change has been increasing exponentially over hundreds of thousands of years. Possibly within our lifetimes, we will be confronted with a very interesting time, when we may have to contend with seven new paradigms before breakfast every day. Steve Pemberton, The Computer as Extended Phenotype

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Exponential curve not guaranteed; could simply be an S-curve. (a. if more bold, one might dare read as: a terrible generalization made by a few decades of silicon valley narcissistic/onanistic worship: or, play a round of "guess the continuous function" with only a finite number of plot points. b. indefinite exponential growth would demand (i) at least that reality is infinitely divisible, or (ii) that maximum entropy of a system could be overcome (aka (i) methodologically self-imposed epistemic limit, (ii) structural (ontic) limit.))
Furthermore, Stevey's phrase "extend our abilities" requires either an (1) ethical or (2) biological caveat ((1) being defensible either by a collectivist or transhumanist interpretation, (2) being favorable if one ignores the effects on the hippocampus. And in general if one ignores the internet as we know it as a literal (read, "physical") reconfiguring of the reward systems and neural connections (via neuroplasticity) of the brain by the profit margins of Google (who makes more money as the number of ads per unit of time increases (e.g. free internet and project glass)).
I don't want to go overboard as I drifted from the abstract to the more specialized, and as we know that's always a philosophic faux pas.

item.title: Ascetic Capitalism (Democratic Austerity of the People)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Capital: The only way a philosopher can make a living off of one’s practical philosophy, is to modernize acceptance of pain for everyone, which requires the marketable experience of pain itself. Modernization is a concept within gestalt psychology which outlines a set of methodologies for describing pain felt by any expression of existence. Those being organic, digital, mechanical (material). In a way, I’m attempting to one up Daniel Dennett’s _intentional stance_, which more or less does the same thing; however, such a position on phenomenological being antedates his philosophical methodology in that it posits the rejection of lost epiphenomenal data, and grants it causal force by describing it under a quantum mechanical conceptual scheme. Phenomenology may even grant the truth of epiphenomenalism, in that psychological events do not intercept the natural, or mechanical, causal chain of events, and even further that psychophysical laws themselves do not exist. However, those events whereby interaction might occur do not lack description, but only the posit of real causal force. A total picture of reality would not defeat the counterfactual situation of that description’s content. But rather culminate the essential rules necessary to produce anything called a total picture. This should not show that the psychological laws do not possess real causal force, but only that the laws may be described multiply.
(( "We the People". ))

item.title: Newstruth
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
What I find interesting is perhaps an "efficiency rate of truth."
So, for instance, news media has, let's say, an obligation to ensure that further evidence on a news thread won't entirely invalidate previous reports or disclosure. So, one might say
that the news media is expected to produce a certain quality and quantity of truth within a certain time after event, E, but further truths discovered may negatively affect the overall perceived veracity of newer reports.
Perhaps another way to put it is that the onus in on a news source to be consistent with itself and its own evidence in the face of a time crunch;
this all generally influences the overall rate of efficiency of truth towards integration into an established belief economy.
